title: Mjukvaruutvecklare inom Telecom
description:
**Vill du vara med och utveckla mjukvara i teknikens absoluta framkant? På Combitech kan vi erbjuda tekniska utmaningar och ett meningsfullt arbete med målet att bygga ett mer motståndskraftigt och hållbart samhälle.**

**Din roll som Software Developer**
-----------------------------------


Vi söker nu mjukvaruutvecklare av komplexa inbyggda realtidssystem inom teknikområdet 5G. Du kommer att ingå i ett agilt team på cirka sju personer som ansvarar för produktens hela utvecklingscykel, d.v.s. systemering, design och test på flera nivåer. I uppdraget har ni som team nära samarbete med andra utvecklare, kravställare och testare. Exempel på språk och verktyg vi använder är C, C++, Java, Matlab och Git*.* Du kommer att utgå från Combitechs kontor i Trollhättan.

**Vem är du?**
--------------


Du har en civil- eller högskoleingenjörsexamen med relevant inriktning. Du skall ha ett stort intresse för teknik och har några års erfarenhet. Du gillar att jobba i team där alla bidrar med sin kunskap för att nå gemensamma mål och att utveckla teamets arbetssätt och färdighet. Uppdraget förutsätter goda kunskaper i engelska såväl i tal som skrift, det är också meriterande om du behärskar svenska i tal och skrift.


För oss är dina personliga egenskaper viktiga och vi är väldigt lyhörda för dina intressen och karriärmål. Som konsult är du ambassadör för Combitech hos våra kunder, därför sätter vi stor vikt vid din personlighet.

**Då tjänsten innebär arbete som kan omfattas av försvarssekretess krävs det att du genomför och godkänns i en säkerhetsprövning.**

**Urval sker löpande. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**

**Kom och gör skillnad**
------------------------


På Combitech ingår vårt kompetensutvecklingsprogram Combitech GROW som en naturlig del i din anställning! Vi ger dig möjlighet att växa i en företagskultur som uppmuntrar till både personlig och professionell utveckling, samtidigt som du arbetar i spännande och givande uppdrag.


Hos oss får du vara med och utveckla teknikområden för att möta kraven på framtidens digitala samhälle. Vi har flera projekt inom digitalisering, autonomi, artificiell intelligens, cyber security och 5G-utveckling. Våra konsulter utvecklar också flygande hjärtstartare, system som ökar säkerheten på flygplatser och nya stridsflygplanet Gripen E som gör samhällen trygga!

**Vill du veta mer om hur det är att arbeta hos oss? Kolla in** **våra karriärsidor!**

**Kontakt/rekryterande chef:** Johan Vaern +46 73 4183002

title: Systemutvecklare
description:
*Vill du arbeta med moderna tekniker i ett agilt arbetssätt och har gedigen erfarenhet av systemutveckling i Java? Då kan du vara vår nästa kollega!* *Hos oss har vi ett högt engagemang samtidigt som vi är* *övertygade om att framgång kommer ifrån av att ha roligt på jobbet. Låter det intressant? Läs vidare! Placeringsort för tjänsten är Stockholm.*  


**Om jobbet**
Vi satsar stort och implementerar en helt ny försäkringsplattform baserad på GuideWire för företags- och lantbruksförsäkringar. Projektet utvecklar egna autonoma tjänster för att möjliggöra systemintegration mellan den nya plattformen och andra miljöer. I din roll som systemutvecklare är din huvudsakliga uppgift att implementera den nya GuideWire plattformen för att möta affärens behov.  

I arbetsuppgifterna ingår bland annat:
* Analys av user stories, acceptanskriterier och användarscenarios.
* Analys och kodning av tester.
* Konfiguration och kodning utifrån ramverk i GuideWire.
* Planera och genomföra demos, korta dagliga statusmöte med utvecklingsteamet.
* Medverka i designworkshops, sprintplanering och backlog grooming.

  


Ansvarsområden:
* Testdriven utveckling – säkerställa att design och kod är testbar.
* Kodkvalitet - säkerställa att best practice tillämpas.
* IT säkerhet - säkerställa att riktlinjer följs.
* Dokumentation - säkerställa att tillräcklig och nödvändig systemdokumentation hålls uppdaterad.
* Hålla dig uppdaterad på best practice och standard inom GuideWire utveckling.

  


Du arbetar i team, men tar eget ansvar i en miljö med olika nationaliteter och konstellationer där både engelska och svenska används i tal och skrift. Teamet ansvarar gemensamt för att leverera systemlösningar utifrån övergripande affärskrav och behov. Vi ser att du framåt blir en av våra experter på den nya lösningen och dess integrationer.  


**Vem är du?**
Vi söker en nyfiken och social lagspelare som är lösningsorienterad, gillar att jobba tätt ihop med affären och vill hjälpa till med att bygga en fin gemenskap på jobbet. Du är bra på att lyssna och frågvis och heller inte rädd för att sticka ut hakan ibland.  


Du har god erfarenhet av systemutveckling i Java och testdriven utveckling (TDD/BDD) samt agila metoder (SAFe, scrum och kanban). Har du erfarenhet av försäkringsbranschen och jobbat som utvecklare i GuideWires plattform och är certifierad är det ett starkt plus.  


**Om oss**
Du kommer ingå i ett agilt team med SAFe som ramverk där teamet förväntas ta ett stort eget ansvar. Vi är övertygade om att framgång kommer av att ha roligt på jobbet! Som din chef är jag stöttande och engagerad. Förutom det egna teamet har du ett stort kontaktnät med andra team och IT-leveransfunktioner såsom IT-säkerhet och infrastruktur. Du utför även demos för affärsägare och andra intressenter samt deltar i aktuella community of practice.  


**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande?* *Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*  


**Sista ansökningsdag:** **2024-09-24**
  
Kort om tjänsten


**Anställningsform:** Tillsvidare
**Arbetsplats:** Stockholm
**Chef:** Kaj Holmberg
**Kontaktuppgifter:** kaj.holmberg@lansforsakringar.se
Vill du vara en del av lösningen, när livet förändras?


Bli en del av något större och börja jobba hos oss. En karriär hos Länsförsäkringar handlar lika mycket om att vara en hjälpande hand för våra kunder genom alla livets skeenden som att stärka lokalsamhället där du verkar.
company_description: Vill du vara en del av lösningen, när livet förändras?

title: Function Developer - Vehicle State Estimation
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**Shaping tomorrow's technology**
---------------------------------


We at Volvo Group are constantly moving and changing to be one step ahead in the technology journey. Within Volvo Group Trucks Technology, we are always adapting and pushing ourselves to be able to develop new breakthrough transport solutions. We strive to be more energy efficient, more sustainable and safer for society. Our organization is built by engaged people and teamwork. We are a truly global company, and we believe in the advantage of diversity. Together we create a workplace that brings the best out of everyone and this is where you fit right in.

  

At Vehicle Technology, we are passionate about shaping tomorrow’s technology to create excellent sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions to make the world a better place for future generations. We provide innovative, safe and driver friendly solutions, we develop top quality services and we make our customer operations more efficient by using excellent data insights. We support the Volvo Group engineering community with cutting edge tools and methods.

**What’s in it for you?**
-------------------------


Are you passionate for changes and innovations and want to be part of a paradigm shift in the development of transport and mobility solutions?  

Now you have the possibility to join a stimulating and dynamic global work environment in an energetic professional agile team with strong teamwork.  

Do you think it sounds interesting? Then this Function Developer position could be the job for you!

 **This is us:**

  

The group Vehicle Motion State Estimation within Motion Estimation & Vehicle Automation sub-stream is responsible for the development and maintenance of different types of estimations such as longitudinal and lateral velocity, yaw rate and accelerations. This we do for different Volvo internal customers, like ADAS, Powertrain and Vehicle Dynamics to be used in many different applications.

  

In this role you will report to Nicolas Andersson - Group Manager Motion Estimation

**Who are you?**
----------------


We believe that you are someone with genuine interest in design and development of automotive vehicle functions. You are someone that is willing to work hands-on in applying the knowledge.  

We believe you are creative and have the mindset to constantly learn and improve to have the best solutions for our customers. You have a positive outlook and collaborative mindset.

  

To be successful in this role, we believe that you have the following background and qualifications:

* M.Sc. degree in Vehicle Dynamics, Control systems, Mechatronics, Robotics or similar
* At least 7 years work experience in function and/or software development, preferably within automotive.
* Thorough hands-on knowledge in how to apply the functional safety (ISO26262) principles in function and/or software development. Knowledge in SOTIF (ISO21448) is meritorious.
* Good knowledge in Control engineering, Software development, Signal processing and/or Sensor fusion.
* Understanding of Application SW development and the related environment.
* Well experienced with tools such as Matlab (Simulink), CANalyzer, as well as rapid prototyping and systems development principles.
* Familiar with C programming and tools such as GIT, Vector DaVinci, CANoe, CANalyzer, dSpace, SystemWeaver (SE-TOOL)
**What will you do?**
---------------------


As a Function developer, your key responsibilities include:

  

* SW development within our continuous integration framework, delivering SW updates to production vehicles.
* Lead and support the team in how to apply functional safety development principles, in the development of the SW.
* Algorithm design and proof of concept investigations for new motion estimation and motion prediction functionality.
* Testing of software in both test bench and vehicle environments.
* Specification and evaluation of new motion sensor technology as well as new sensor fusion techniques.
**Ready for the next move?**
----------------------------


Volvo Group believes in diversity, equity, and inclusion and offers a safe environment to grow. Use your open mind and can-do attitude to help us steer our transportation solutions toward a more sustainable tomorrow.


Come, join us as we take our solutions into a new era and make modern life possible. Let's drive progress together.

  

If you are interested in this position and want to know more you are welcome to contact Nicolas Andersson via email - nicolas.andersson@volvo.com or Arpitha BG - Talent Advisor at arpitha.bangalore.giri@consultant.volvo.com

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

 **Group Trucks Technology** are seeking talents to help design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of our team, you’ll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Software Developer assistance systems, SGT
description:
Toyota as an employer
  
  

At Toyota Material Handling, we strive to be a friendly, safe, and progressive workplace. The culture is based on Toyota's values, where respect and caring actions are key words in the daily work. Our ambition is to strengthen competitiveness by increasing diversity in operations and taking advantage of differences. Through our environmental work, ambitious climate goals and our personnel policy, we work to be a sustainable employer.
  
  

In order to create the conditions for a sustainable everyday life, we offer our employees flextime and the opportunity to work remotely on a part-time basis. We have good training opportunities with free access to gyms and group training, as well as a generous wellness allowance.
  
  

At Toyota Material Handling R&D we are developing next generation autonomous fork-lifts and advanced assistance systems. We offer an opportunity to join our software teams, where you as a skilled engineer can develop new functionality that easily can be tested on complete vehicles in our close-by large lab area.
  
  

**As a Software Engineer at Toyota you will work with:**  

* Development of applications for our autonomous fork-lifts.
* Development of assistance systems for our manual fork-lifts.
* Industrial projects and concept vehicles.


This position is in a team responsible for embedded applications running in both fully autonomous vehicles and manual fork lifts. Examples of applications are load handling application that combines multiple sensors to determine correct next action or an obstacle detect application that will take action if an obstacle occurs in drive-path. Team works with input from multiple sensors, such as LIDAR, ultrasound or Cameras.
  
  

We are looking for an engineer that have a good analytic capability, that can transform this capabilities into algorithms that can run on an embedded device. Programming is your natural language. Background could be an interest in control theory, signal processing, machine-learning and machine vision. Enjoy working close to hardware is an advantage, understanding sensor output or ability to optimize driving behavior based on your new control algorithm.
  
  

Team is working both with industrial projects and future technology exploration.
  
  

Who is R&D Toyota Material Handling?
  
  

Toyota Material Handling is a world leader in material handling and we are making large investments to meet the needs of the future. At our R&D department in Mjölby, 300 employees work on the development of our products and services as well as new innovative solutions. At Toyota, we work with a holistic perspective where employees have responsibility from concept to finished product.
  
  

At Toyota, we combine classic design with modern technology in automation, IoT and AI. Our product portfolio ranges from manual hand trucks to driverless vehicles with advanced technology. In the R&D department, we work with short development cycles to meet the demand of a rapidly growing market.
  
  

Together, we work in cross-functional teams with agile working methods. Everyday life at R&D alternates between theory and practice, with great opportunities for our engineers to test their new technical solutions in practice in our extensive modern test lab. Our large-scale production lies side by side with R&D, which creates good conditions for direct feedback from the practical application of the products.
  
  

The employees in R&D describe our managers and leaders as inclusive, attentive and without prestige. We at Toyota are keen to create a familiar working climate with opportunities for personal development and good career prospects.
  
  

Your Profile
  
  

* Experience from Embedded SW development.
* Master's degree in computer science or Master of Science in Engineering, or equivalent.
* Good knowledge in signal and control technology.
* C/C++/Python experience.


Application
  
  

Welcome with your application no later than 2024-09-29. The selection process will begin after the application deadline.
  
  

**For more information please contact:**  

* Johan Lindell, Manager Application Software, +46 730529963

title: Min Doktor söker Back-end utvecklare till Malmö
description:
Vill du vara med på vår spännande resa och skapa framtidens vårdbolag och tjänster? Vi söker nu dig som är back-end utvecklare och som vill utveckla och utvecklas tillsammans med oss!
  
Allt vi gör på Min Doktor gör vi i tron om att sjukvård ska vara så tillgänglig och kvalitativ som möjligt. Vi leder utvecklingen av digital hälsa i Sverige, med fokus på hög medicinsk kvalitet och patientsäkerhet. Med hjälp av modern teknik och ständigt nytänkande skapar vi effektiva vårdprocesser som både ökar tillgängligheten till vård och frigör resurser så samhället klarar att möta morgondagens vårdbehov. Vi samarbetar med försäkringsbolag, landsting och privata vårdverksamheter och vi håller ständigt utkik efter innovationer inom uppkopplad hälsa.
  
Min Doktor är både en modern vårdgivare – som bedriver hälso- och sjukvård med nya, digitala verktyg och arbetssätt – och en modern arbetsgivare. Patienten och medarbetaren är alltid i centrum. Hos oss får du vara med och skapa framtidens primärvård. Min Doktor är en engagerad arbetsgivare som visar uppskattning för din insats. Hos oss får du bra villkor, en trevlig arbetsplats med härliga kollegor och fantastiskt nöjda patienter.
  
Att arbeta som back-end utvecklare hos Min Doktor
  
Som utvecklare hos oss kommer du att vara del i en relativt liten och sammansvetsad produktorganisation, där arbetet är drivet av product discovery och insights. Ett nära samarbete mellan UX, produktägare och utvecklingsteamet är för oss viktigt precis som samarbetet i och mellan våra två utvecklingsteam. I denna roll finns det stora möjligheter för nytänkande, initiativtagande och personlig utveckling såväl som stora möjligheter att påverka produkten.
  
Att vara back-end utvecklare på Min Doktor innebär att du kommer:
  
Vara del i ett team av engagerade utvecklare där vi tillsammans designar, bygger och driftsätter lösningar för framtidens digitala vård
  
Dagligen utveckla och förbättra de appar som våra patienter respektive vårdgivare möter
  
**Designa robusta, tydliga API:** er samt delta i övergripande arkitekturella diskussioner
  
Underhålla och optimera vår deployment setup, med fokus på maintainability, skalbarhet, hög tillgänglighet samt säkerhet.
  
Vara delaktig i diskussioner i strategin framåt för vår plattform och arkitektur
  
Ta ett helhetsansvar och coacha juniora kollegor
  
Få lov att ta tillvara på det du brinner för och få möjlighet att ge uttryck för det på bästa sätt.
  
  

Tjänsten utgår primärt från vårt kontor i Malmö och rapporterar till development team lead.Vi arbetar hybrid och vi vill gärna se dig på kontoret 1dag/vecka!
  
Vem söker vi?
  
Här är några saker som vi tror skulle göra att du skulle trivas och vara framgångsrik i rollen som frontend utvecklare på Min Doktor.
  
Du har dokumenterad erfarenhet av att jobba i team med BE utveckling, gärna i Golang och i cloud native miljö, i minst 5 år. Har du erfarenhet av att arbeta med systemdesign/arkitektur samt teknisk strategi är det ett stort plus.
  
Du har erfarenhet av SQL databaser
  
Du är framåttänkande och gillar att hålla dig uppdaterad på nya tekniker
  
Du tycker om att dela med dig av erfarenheter och sprida kunskap till kollegor
  
Du är självgående och tar gärna egna initiativ
  
Du tycker om att engagera dig i planeringsarbete och way of working, och har gärna erfarenhet av det sen tidigare
  
Du sätter en stolthet och förstår värdet i att skriva högkvalitativ mjukvara, samtidigt som du kan balansera detta mot inkommande krav och förstår vikten av att kontinuerligt släppa ut nya features till våra vårdgivare och patienter
  
Du tycker om att ta egna initiativ och brinner för att vara med och forma vår tekniska plattform
  
Du gillar att arbeta i team och tillsammans bollar ni fram den bästa lösningen givet situationen
  
Du har erfarenhet och gillar att samarbeta med UX - där ni tillsammans jobbar iterativt för att hitta en bra balans mellan tekniska val och användarupplevelse.
  
  

**Vår teknikstack består av:**  

React / Typescript
  
React Native / Typescript
  
Next.js
  
REST API
  
Golang
  
Postgres
  
GCP/Docker/Kubernetes
  
Om Min Doktor
  
Min Doktor är Sveriges första digitala vårdgivare och erbjuder patienter snabb läkarvård oberoende av tid och plats. Bolaget startades 2013 med en idé från en läkare som såg möjligheten att både effektivisera läkarens arbete och korta vårdköerna genom att skapa smidiga patientmöten på distans. Idag är Min Doktor en av Sveriges största vårdcentraler och har hanterat över en miljon patientärenden.
  
Hos oss arbetar 200+ kollegor med varierande bakgrund och perspektiv - allt från vårdpersonal till utvecklare, marknadsförare och kvalitetssamordnare. Tillsammans utvecklar vi vår tjänst från huvudkontoret i Malmö eller från någon av våra mottagningar. Vår mångfald i såväl kompetens som perspektiv är en stark tillgång för såväl företaget som för våra patienter. Möjligheten att växa och lära från briljanta medarbetare är oändlig.
  
Min Doktor är registrerad vårdgivare och omfattas av hälso- och sjukvårdslagen, personuppgiftslagen, patientdatalagen och patientsäkerhetslagen. Min Doktor ägs till 42 procent av Apotek Hjärtat och 58 procent av övriga ägare, däribland EQT Ventures Fund.

title: Systemutvecklare till deepNumbers Components
description:
Vi söker en erfaren systemvetare till deepNumbers Components.
  
Rollen som systemutvecklare på deepNumbers Components passar dig som har en passion för programmering och vill arbeta med utveckling och drift av vår hemsida samt web shop.
  
Tjänsten passar dig som är flexibel och van att arbeta självständigt.
  
Krav är akademisk bakgrund inom IT på universitetsnivå eller högskola samt erfarenhet från liknande arbete.
  
Vi vill att du talar minst grundläggande svenska samt god engelska.

title: Senior Java - utvecklare
description:
CTEK designar och utvecklar våra lågspännings- och elfordonsladdare (EVSE) i Norrköping, Stockholm och Vikmanshyttan. På utvecklingsavdelningen jobbar vi verkligen fullstack – vi gör allt från mekanik, till hårdvara/elektronik, till inbyggda system, till vårt IoT-team med backend- och apputveckling.
  
Till detta IoT-team anställer vi nu en senior Java - utvecklare.
  
Många av våra produkter är uppkopplade, och våra backend-lösningar fungerar som integration mellan laddare och laddoperatör och/eller slutkund. Backend utvecklas tajt med appen - ditt team består nämligen av en mix av backendutvecklare, ux-designers samt app-utvecklare. Vi använder scrum eller Kanban tillsammans med produktcheferna, vilka också hanterar vår roadmap och driver fram visionen. Teamet är autonomt och har därmed stor frihet/möjlighet att välja tekniska lösningar.
  
Rekryterande chef Per Rahnel; ”Jag tror på att bygga förtroende och inspirera mina teammedlemmar att ta ansvar. För mig är ledarskap att värna om medarbetarna ochstötta dem för att ge arbetsro att göra ett bra jobb.”
  
Vem du ärVi söker dig sombrinner för att lösa problem inom mjukvaruutveckling. Du har erfarenhet av tjänstesystem, molntjänster och integrationer. Du är en senior lagspelare som uppskattar en rolig, stöttande och inkluderande miljö.
  
Vad du har med dig Flera års erfarenhet av backend-utveckling
  
Programmeringskunskaper; Java, Spring Boot, Python, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, MySQL, Amazon Web Services och Azure DevOps
  
Erfarenhet av att arbeta i team och tvärfunktionella organisationer
  
Utbildningsbakgrund inom datavetenskap, programvaruteknik eller liknande
  
Jira, agil utveckling
  
Vad vi erbjuder Vara en del av det gröna teknikskiftet, dess utmaningar och möjligheter
  
Trevliga kollegor och en stödjande, hjälpande och lärorik miljö
  
Stora utvecklingsmöjligheter, då vi har helhetsansvar och gör många olika saker på CTEK
  
Hybridarbetsplats
  
Kollektivavtal i form av Teknikavtalet
  
Fördelaktig elfordonsladdning på kontoren
  
Personalrabatt på våra produkter
  
Utrustning för hemmakontor
  
Om CTEK
  
CTEK med huvudkontor i Vikmanshyttan i Dalarna är internationellt ledande inom batteriladdningslösningar, huvudsakligen för fordon. Företaget utvecklar en rad olika produkter för fordonsbranschen, från 12V & 24V-laddare till laddningslösningar för elfordon. Produkterna säljs via globala distributörer och återförsäljare, till fler än 50 av världens ledande fordonstillverkare samt genom laddpunktsoperatörer, fastighetsägare och andra aktörer för att ge tillgång till el-laddningsinfrastruktur.
  
Ansök senast 30 september 2024.

title: Backend Java Developer - Platform Group
description:
Are you a talented Backend Java Developer looking for your next challenge? At Assessio, we’re on a mission to revolutionize talent management solutions, and we need innovative minds like yours to help us build the next generation of our platforms.
  
Why Assessio?
  
Assessio is a leading Talent Assessment provider in the Nordics and the Netherlands, committed to creating a fair and effective labor market. We believe in Zero Talent Waste— where everyone’s potential is valued, and organizations find the perfect match for their needs. Our SaaS solutions, developed in-house, are at the forefront of this mission, and we’re growing rapidly to keep up with demand.
  
  

**As part of our team, you’ll benefit from:**  

A competitive salary and a generous wellness allowance.
  
Six weeks of vacation to recharge and relax.
  
A bonus scheme to reward your hard work and dedication.
  
Flexible work arrangements—including the option to work remotely for a number of dayseachweek.
  
Comprehensive pension plans through collective agreements with Almega and the white-collar unions Unionen and Akademikerförbunden.
  
A vibrant work culture with shared workouts, after-work events, and seasonal parties.
  
Job Description
  
As a Backend Java Developer at Assessio, you’ll play a critical role in building the microservices that power our innovative talent management platforms. Your work will directly impact our ability to provide fairer hiring practices and development tools that help individuals realize their full potential.
  
  

**You’ll be working with:**  

Java 21 and Spring 6 in a microservices architecture.
  
Cloud-native environments powered by Kubernetes and AWS.
  
Cutting-edge technologies like GenAI, Kafka, GRPC, PostgreSQL, GraphQL, and more.
  
  

**This is a unique opportunity to:**  

Influence key technology and product decisions as part of a small, highly skilled team.
  
Develop T-shaped skills, allowing you to specialize while also broadening your expertise across the technology stack.
  
Be part of a diverse team with a range of cultural backgrounds, working both on-site and remotely.
  
What You’ll Do Design and develop scalable, resilient, and secure microservices using Java and Spring Boot.
  
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure our solutions meet business needs and deliver real value.
  
Implement industry-leading security practices to protect our platforms and ensure compliance.
  
Contribute to and maintain technical documentation for our backend architecture.
  
Play a key role in our agile development processes, driving continuous improvement and innovation.
  
Who You Are
  
At Assessio, we value who you are over what you’ve done. If you have the right attitude, are eager to learn, and are driven to achieve your goals, we’ll support you every step of the way.
  
  

**To succeed in this role, you should have:**  

A bachelor's degree or higher in a relevant engineering field.
  
Proven expertise in Java, Spring, and backend technologies.
  
A solid understanding of microservices design patterns.
  
Knowledge of modern authentication and authorization mechanisms, such as OAuth and SSO.
  
Proficiency in English— both spoken and written.
  
Bonus Points For Experience working with agile teams and processes.
  
Familiarity with cloud-native technologies.
  
A passion for solving complex problems and creating innovative solutions.
  
  

Join us at Assessio and be part of a team that’s not just building software but also making a meaningful impact on people’s lives. Let’s create a world with Zero Talent Waste together!
  
Our recruitment process
  
Does this sound like the right job for you? Send us your application today!
  
To make sure we give everyone a fair chance and base our decisions on data, and not just gut feeling, we always start a process with our in-house assessments —problem-solving (Matrigma) and personality (MAP). It will take you approximately 30 minutes, and we guarantee valuable feedback after the assessments and a quick response from our side. You can find more info about the process at our Career Site.
  
We look forward to getting in touch!
  
If you have any questions regarding the recruitment process, please contact our Director ofEngineering,Anton Bagchi:
  
* anton.bagchi@assessio.se

title: iOS developer to Digital Channels | SEB, Solna
description:
Private and Corporate Digital Channels mission is to provide a world-class customer experience for SEB customers. The channels we are covering are different segments within our Business, such as Internet bank, Business arena, Mobile applications and Nexus.
  
Now we are seeking for our new star in iOS development who is driven to influence our application development for the present and for the future!
  
What you will be doing
  
As an iOS developer you will work with development of SEB's mobile applications for private, corporate and youth customers. You will be a part of a cross functional team consisting of colleagues working with development, test and integration. In the role you will develop, maintain, design and implement new user-facing applications. The applications displays most of SEB's services, therefore you will collaborate with a large variety of colleagues both from the IT and Business area. The applications are used by a large number of consumers, therefore we are actively ensuring that it is robust, scalable and accessible 24/7/365.
  
Another important part of your role is to pay attention to the practices and methodologies used in mobile development and share the knowledge with other team members. The method we use to divide code is MVVM (Model, View, View Model) and Xcode is our development environment. In addition to that we use UICollectionView.
  
Who we are looking for
  
To thrive and succeed in this role, you take your own initiative in a technically competent team. As a person you can be constructive in a group and be inspired by taking responsibility and driving change through new technology. Thus, you will have the ability to collaborate with multiple colleagues, strong communication skills, driven and have an analytical mindset. You have a great interest in tools, architecture and design.
  
  

**We believe that you have:**  

* Experience in working with iOS development
* Experience in working with Swift, preferably with Combine framework
* Experience of working with objective-C is meritorious
* Fluency in English is required as it is our corporate language


What we offer
  
We offer many experiences and benefits to our employees, and there is nuance to every individual’s career experience, but the elements that define the core of our offering are:
  
* Deliver world-class service to customers
* Opportunities to help transform an industry
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Attractive compensation and benefits

title: IOS Developer in Media
description:
Professional Galaxy is now looking for two tvOS/iOS developers who will work with a prominent streaming service. The developers will be part of a specialized Apple team within a larger client team, which also includes developers for Android, SmartTV/HbbTV and web. The team works closely with a product owner, art director, UX designers, QA, and analysts.


To thrive and succeed in this role, we are looking for people who are curious and open to exploring new solutions, both technically and methodologically.


A strong focus is placed on creating well-functioning teams. We appreciate individuals who are proactive and come up with new ideas, while also being pragmatic and able to deal with challenges and problems effectively.


Requirements for candidates:

* Very good knowledge in app development, especially with a focus on tvOS, Swift concurrency and SwiftUI
* Strong understanding of iOS/tvOS design patterns and best practices
* At least five years of experience in system development
* High creativity and excellent collaboration


Meritorious qualifications:

* Experience working with Chromecast and Android
* Experience working with major media apps or streaming services


Start: October


Language: English or Swedish


Location: Stockholm (the majority of the assignment takes place on site)'

***Please note that we present the candidates on an ongoing basis so job can be removed before the deadline. If you are interested, we recommend that you apply immediately!***

title: Senior Web Developer (Ruby on Rails)
description:
Auctionet is a marketplace where auction houses from Sweden, the UK, Finland, Spain, Germany and Denmark sell furniture, art, design items, collectibles and more. We are a small, tight-knit Product & Development team, and are now in search of our next **Senior Web Developer for the Marketplace team** – responsible for the system used by almost 1 million consumers today!

#### **About the work**


The Marketplace team is responsible for building the end-customer-facing auction marketplace at auctionet.com, including our iOS and Android apps. The ambition is to create the world's best auction marketplace, filled with interesting items and content, for buyers across the globe.


A few examples of possible upcoming projects for the Marketplace team that might give you a sense of what you'll be working on:

* Re-imagine the search and browse experience.
* Work with personalisation to match items with buyers.
* Optimise background jobs for sending notifications about newly published items.


Our main stack is Ruby on Rails, Turbo and Stimulus.


We’re into modern technology and agile methodology. We try new things constantly and keep the things we like – such as pair programming, automated testing, retrospectives, code review, trunk-based development with continuous deployment, and DevOps. We've documented some of our practices in our devbook.


We are taking inspiration from Shape Up, alternating 4 weeks of planned work with 2 weeks of "cooldown" – tying up loose ends, doing maintenance, improving our tooling and trying out new languages or frameworks.


We operate from our offices in central Stockholm and Malmö, with the option to work remotely. We value your well-being, offering flexible work hours, discouraging overtime, and encouraging full use of your Wellness Grant. You'll enjoy six weeks of paid vacation, along with a work phone and the computer of your choice to help you excel. Beyond supporting your lifestyle, we’re committed to your growth. That’s why we provide a generous budget and time allowance for attending conferences, code retreats, or courses, so you can continue learning and advancing your skills.


We contribute to open source, release our own libraries, and attend and arrange meetups.

#### **About you**


We're looking for an experienced Ruby on Rails developer with an eye for detail who likes to take ownership over both big and small projects, and take them from start to production. You write clean, maintainable code that is well tested. We also believe you have:

* **Experience:** At least 5 years of professional web development experience.
* **Good communication skills:** You can explain complex concepts to both technical and non-technical co-workers.
* **Passion:** You take pride in your work and want to deliver code with high quality.
* **A curious mindset:** You are open to learning and sharing knowledge with others.
* **A team player mentality:** You help others and ask for help when needed. We do a lot of pair programming!


We also value if you have an interest in art, design or collectibles. An interest in product design is also a plus.


The role is mostly back-end heavy, but since we're a small team you'll often touch the front-end as well. Sometimes also our native apps (which are mostly web views).


Please note we are only accepting candidates **resident in Sweden** at this time.


If that is you, apply now! Got questions? Reach out to our team anytime.

#### **The interview process**


In the interview process, we'll discuss some of your existing work, or a small take-home Rails exercise, or we'll build a small feature inside our web app. We don't do "gotcha" whiteboard interviews.

#### **Who we are**


Auctionet was founded in 2011 by a team of people with unique experience of online auctions. Read more about Auctionet here.


In 2021 Auctionet acquired the auction house Stockholms Auktionsverk, and we are now by far the largest auction marketplace in the Nordics, and one of the larger auction marketplaces in the world. With this acquisition, Auctionet owns and operates both the oldest auction house in the world (1674) and the second oldest (1681), which means we have been working with sustainability for 350(!) years.


Join us in our mission to help new owners inspire new life into old items!

title: Frontend Platform Developer
description:
**Frontend Platform Developer**
**Target Start Date:** **September/October**
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Position Overview:**


As a frontend developer, you will be responsible for creating interactive user interfaces for our platform. Your primary focus will be on implementing visually appealing designs and ensuring seamless functionality across various devices and browsers. You will collaborate with a team of designers, back-end developers, and project managers to deliver high-quality scalable solutions.


**Responsibilities:**

* Develop front-end interfaces for our clients.




* Collaborate with UI/UX designers to implement design mockups.




* Write clean, modular, and maintainable code using HTML, CSS, Typescript, and React.js




* Deliver responsive and visually appealing user interfaces.




* Optimise website performance to provide a seamless user experience.




* Conduct thorough testing and debugging to identify and fix front-end issues and ensure


cross-browser compatibility.





* Collaborate closely with the back-end development team to ensure effective integration


of front-end and back-end components.



* Stay up-to-date with the latest front-end development trends, techniques, and best


practices, and propose innovative solutions to improve user experience and overall



product quality.



* Communicate effectively with team members, project managers, and stakeholders to


understand requirements, provide status updates, and ensure timely project delivery.


**Experience and Skills:**


* 4+ years of experience as a frontend developer preferably




* Strong proficiency in HTML, CSS, Typescript and React.js.


* Experience with responsive design techniques and building mobile-friendly interfaces.


* Knowledge of cross-browser compatibility issues and solutions, as well as web


performance optimization techniques.



* Understanding of UX/UI design principles and ability to collaborate effectively with


designers.



* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.


* Excellent communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.

title: Fullstackutvecklare inom React & TypeScript
description:
**Är du en grym fullstackutvecklare med passion för teknik och innovation?**


Vi på QueensLab är ett team av dedikerade utvecklare och designers som alltid strävar efter att bryta ny mark och skapa framtidens digitala lösningar. Nu letar vi efter vår nästa kollega som med sin erfarenhet och drivkraft vill vara med och utveckla spännande projekt och ta oss till nya höjder!

### **Är du vår nya stjärna?**


Vi söker en fullstackutvecklare som älskar utmaningar och har gedigen erfarenhet av att arbeta med React, TypeScript, och Next.js. Du är trygg i din roll, pragmatisk och har en naturlig förmåga att lösa problem. Du har troligtvis arbetat i en ledande roll tidigare och känner dig hemma med Document DB och relaterade tekniker.


Vi ser också att du har koll på DevOps och agila arbetsmetoder. Har du dessutom erfarenhet av IoT, CAN Bus-kommunikation, CouchDB/PouchDB eller Azure-tjänster är det en stor fördel. Men det är inte bara tekniken som är viktig – vi tror att du, precis som vi, tycker att design och UX är avgörande för att skapa riktigt bra digitala upplevelser.

### **Vem är du som person?**


På QueensLab är vi övertygade om att ett starkt team är nyckeln till framgång. Vi söker dig som trivs med att arbeta i team och bidrar till en stark samarbetskultur. Vi är prestigelösa och orädda för att testa nytt, och vi hoppas att du delar den inställningen. För oss är det viktigt att arbetet inte bara är meningsfullt, utan också roligt.

### **Livet på Slottet**


Hos oss kommer du till ett snabbt växande företag som satsar på att vara i framkant både inom teknik och design. QueensLab erbjuder en kreativ och stöttande arbetsmiljö där du får möjlighet att arbeta med nyutvecklingsprojekt och utvecklas i din roll.


Vi erbjuder dessutom:

* Kompetensutveckling och möjligheter till personlig tillväxt.
* Rymliga lokaler i centrala Göteborg, precis vid Domkyrkan.
* Fast lön med goda utvecklingsmöjligheter.
* Flexibla arbetstider och generöst friskvårdsbidrag.
* Mobiltelefon, arbetsdator och tjänstepension.
* Sjukförsäkring och andra förmåner.


Låter detta som något för dig? Då ser vi fram emot din ansökan!

**Välkommen till QueensLab – tillsammans utforskar vi det okända!**

title: Open Application: Frontend Developer
description:
*Are you a passionate and talented Frontend Developer looking for your next challenge? We are always on the lookout for creative and driven individuals to join our team. If you have a knack for creating stunning user interfaces and a love for coding, we want to hear from you!* 



 About the job
 
**Note: This is not an open position, but rather an expression of interest for potential future opportunities.** 



 What you'll do
 * Develop and maintain user-friendly web applications
* Collaborate with designers and backend developers to create seamless user experiences
* Optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability
* Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs
* Stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends and technologies


 Who you are
 * Proven experience as a Frontend Developer or similar role
* Proficiency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and modern frontend frameworks (e.g., React, Angular, Vue.js)
* Strong understanding of responsive design principles
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail

 This is Market Partner
 
*Market Partner is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome to our community regardless of who you are, whom you like, no matter where you come from, or what you look like.*

title: Backend Software Engineer (.NET Core)
description:
**About Us**
 Sinch is a global leader in cloud communications, helping businesses connect with their customers on their mobile phones. We reach every phone on earth, with over 147 billion conversations every year. Our technology powers the world's leading communications platforms.
   

  

 We are a dynamic and innovative team seeking a passionate Backend Software Engineer (.NET Core) to collaborate on our cloud-based communication solutions that are built using the latest versions of C# and .NET Core hosted on AWS using cloud native technologies like Kubernetes and Docker.
   

  

 The working model is hybrid, and you can work from Stockholm or Malmo office.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Create systems that are not only scalable but also resilient, ensuring graceful failure.
* Manage the software lifecycle from design and development to testing and production deployment.
* Work with a range of different technologies and programming languages, but primarily with C# and .NET Core.
* Actively contribute to enhancing our development processes and pipelines.
* Take a hands-on approach to monitoring production environments, identifying issues, and being on-call when necessary.
* Engage closely with software engineers, architects, DevOps specialists, and product managers to deliver exceptional products.


**Requirements**
* Experienced professional in team-based development, deployment, and maintenance of software products in production.
* In-depth knowledge of .NET Core and a deep passion for technology.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.
* Ability to work effectively within a cross-functional self-organizing team, fostering collaboration and mutual respect among team members.
* A passion for writing clean and testable code.
* Bachelor's degree in computer science or related technical discipline.


**Good to have**
* Experience in a similar industry or related one.
* Experience working with service-oriented architecture and distributed systems.
* Experience with Kubernetes or similar technologies.
* Experience working with AWS.
* Proven ability to work with others to solve tough technical problems.
* Ability to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced work environment characteristic of agile development methodologies.
* Experience guiding and mentoring fellow developers empowering them to contribute effectively to team goals.


**Embrace the challenge and join us!**

title: Junior Product Developer for Women H&M
description:
****Job Description****
**Additional Information**
****Job Description****
 As a Jr Product Developer you will have an important role in the exciting and complex process of creating women’s collections to be sold in all our sales countries – all over the world. Together with a tight team, you work with identifying and developing collections, according to current and upcoming global trends. Your main responsibility is to support the Product Developer, creating the best products to our customers. You will be the important link between designers, pattern makers and planners throughout the entire process and make things happen around you. We therefore think that you are a true star when it comes to administrative tasks and sample handling, and love to work when no day is the same and the pace is fast. Here you will get the chance to be part of daily operational tasks and learn from experienced colleagues.
   

  

****Qualifications****
* Working as a Junior Buyer or Junior Product Developer
* Have passion for women’s customer and current fashion products
* Experience and competence within product development
* Driven and ambitious
* Strong salesmanship and see opportunities for growth and profitability
* Being structured, organized and take initiatives
* Being a team player with a flexible attitude
* See possibilities, improvements, and simple solutions


****Additional Information****
 We are recruiting to fill several full time positions with placement in Stockholm and start as soon as possible. If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please send your application including CV
 **latest 15th of September** 
 . Interviews will be held continuously. (For internal candidates, please initiate a dialogue with your manager before applying.)
   

  

**H&M WOMENS ASSORTMENT**
 At the Womenswear Assortment, you will be part of a fast pace environment and work with a current assortment for our customer – always with focus on quality, sustainability, and the best price. You will contribute to making progress towards our vision – A loved women´s fashion destination, leading the change to a sustainable fashion future.
   

  

****Benefits****
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP.
   

  

*In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.*
**Inclusion & Diversity**
*H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.*
*We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.*
 We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Software Engineer – GitHub Enablement
description:
**Job Description**
 We are looking for a talented and driven Software Engineer to join our GitHub Enablement Team. As a member of the Developer Experience Enablement, you will play a crucial role in our company’s transformation by accelerating the developer journey from start to production-ready services. Some of your responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Develop, maintain, and improve our tools and services used in the development process, focusing on GitHub. integrated development environments (IDEs), automated build tools, testing frameworks, and deployment tools.
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of the developer experience by identifying pain points, streamlining processes, and implementing innovative solutions.
* Use CI/CD pipelines to automate processes and tools like GitHub CI/CD, GitHub Actions
* Ensure that development and testing environments are stable, reliable and accurately reflect the production environment.
* Manage and provision infrastructure using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform
* Optimize the development process by reducing build times, improving automated testing and ensuring deployments are fast and reliable.
* Diagnose and fix issues arising in the development process.
* Collaborate closely with other software engineers, architects, and stakeholders to understand requirements and deliver high-quality solutions.


**Qualifications**
* Proficiency in software development, preferably in Typescript, JavaScript or .NET
* Experience with TDD (Test Driven Development)
* Experience with GitHub Actions
* Strong foundation in API-First Development
* Proficiency in CLIs and Linux
* Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and analytically.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with team members and stakeholders.
* It's good if you have familiarity with CI/CD tools


**Additional Information**
 This is a full-time permanent position, starting as soon as possible according to agreement. The role is an on-site position, based in our office in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 Apply by sending in your CV in English as soon as possible, but no later than the 13th of Sep 2024. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through the career page. If you have any questions about the role, please contact responsible recruiter Devika Langar at
 **devika.langar@hm.com**
**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

*In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.*
**Inclusion & Diversity**
 H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organization. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence, all diversity dimensions are considered in our recruitment process.
   

  

**Company Description**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way.  Learn more about H&M here.

title: Fullstack developer
description:
**Om företaget** 




 Unseald är ett snabbväxande och innovativt fintechbolag som utmanar en traditionell bransch genom att förändra hur människor konsumerar innehåll, som till exempel tidningsartiklar. Vi erbjuder en heltäckande lösning som fungerar som ryggraden i våra kunders digitala plattformar – från smidiga engångsköp med vår marknadsledande styckköpslösning till enkel uppstart av prenumerationer med bara två klick. Vi befinner oss i en spännande expansionsfas med många nya produktlanseringar och framgångsrika samarbeten och vi söker nu dig som vill ta ett betydande ansvar och vara med på vår tillväxtresa!
 



  





**Rollen som mid/senior utvecklare på Unseald** 




 Som mid/senior utvecklare hos oss kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i vårt jordnära och dynamiska team. Du kommer att förbättra våra produkter genom att automatisera processer från test till produktion, leda företagets tekniska utveckling tillsammans med våra andra utvecklare, samt planera och strukturera det dagliga arbetet. Vi tror att du trivs i en miljö där det händer mycket och där du verkligen får chansen att påverka produktutbudet och dess utveckling.
 



  





 Vi uppmuntrar dig att ta initiativ och bidra med nya idéer – din input är värdefull för oss. Du kommer att spela en avgörande roll i formandet av våra produkter och ta viktiga beslut, vilket gör din förståelse för löpande underhåll och teknisk utveckling avgörande.
 



  





**Om dig** 




 Vi söker dig som är en erfaren och engagerad mid/senior utvecklare med minst tre års erfarenhet inom mjukvaruutveckling. Du har god kommunikationsförmåga, är ödmjuk och arbetar bra i team. Vi värdesätter din förmåga att dela med dig av din kunskap och din vilja att ta en ledande roll.
 



  





**Vad vi söker hos dig** 



* Gedigen erfarenhet inom mjukvaruutveckling med fokus på JavaScript, Node.js och TypeScript.
* Erfarenhet av att utveckla och underhålla API och webbapplikationer.
* Kompetens inom DevOps.
* Erfarenhet av relationsdatabaser (SQL).
* Goda kunskaper om agila utvecklingsmetoder och Git.
* Erfarenhet av betallösningar som Stripe och Swish är meriterande.



  





**Arbetsplats** 




 Du är varmt välkommen att arbeta med oss på vårt kontor i Södermalm, Stockholm. Beroende på dina önskemål och behov går det lika bra att arbeta på distans.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Vi kommer att tillsätta tjänsten löpande, så vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan – vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
 



  





 Läs gärna mer om oss på www.unseald.com.

title: Backend Developer: EVC
description:
Do you want to solve complex business challenges in a company which is a global leader in the parking industry? Do you want to contribute to software on top of the wave and bring the product to the next level? Do you want to be part of the truly “Empowered team”?
   

  

**The Role**
 Life as an EasyPark’s Backend Software Engineer is all about creating top notch software solutions that meet user needs, solve real life challenges and thus moving us closer to our global vision.
   

  

 Backend Software Engineer in Drivers Experience will face all aspects of serving the needs of an end user of EasyPark application - driver.
   

  

 Ultimately, we want to provide a stable, secure and scalable product for today and the future. Our users will never consider alternatives to EasyPark once they have used our products and solutions!
   

  

**Everyday life as Backend Software Engineer**
* Together with a strong and supportive team you will plan and build new microservices
* Deliver technical enhancements according to the team mission and overarching goals of the company
* Effectively use automated testing strategies to accelerate delivery and constantly rise the quality of the product
* As part of rotation within the team provide ongoing maintenance and 24/7 on-call support
* Be the driving force behind the product innovation according to the strong product leadership approach aka “Empowered teams”
* Take shared responsibility for the team goals and product quality
* Deliver complex solutions as a part of the global leader in the parking industry with a multi million user base


**Technical Skills**
 Competences listed in a prioritized order:
   

  

* Microservices
* Strong JVM knowledge and experience with Object Oriented Programming is required
* Java/Kotlin
* Experience in CI/CD
* Experience with Message Brokers (e.g. Kafka)
* Distributed teamwork experience
* Deployment: Docker, Kubernetes
* DB: PostgreSQL, ORM (Hibernate), Migration (Flyway or Liquibase)
* Testing: Experience with JUnit, Mockito, E2E, Integration tests
* AWS - good bonus


**Life at EasyPark**
 We are a value driven company with an international culture and a global presence. By providing an environment with space to grow and room for autonomy, we believe in encouraging and supporting our team members to take initiatives and act outside of their comfort zone. To have an open mind and embracing change is a part of our DNA. At EasyPark we are dedicated to maintaining an open culture where the voice of each person is heard, and we play as one team across the globe. Diversity is something we celebrate and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for everyone.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Flexible ways of working: combine working from home with working from the office, whatever is agreed on within your team.
* Digital global onboarding: three days to indulge in learning & connecting with fellow new starters across the globe.
* Pension, insurances & health reimbursement: A competitive pension, in combination with the basic package of insurances
* Proactive health support: your wellbeing is important to us, which is why we offer proactive medical support, all depending on your need.
* Mental well-being support via Blue Call
* Wellness reimbursement: 5000 SEK/year


**Fluency in English** 
 is required for this position, however Swedish is not needed.

description:

 Utveckla ny och förvalta funktionalitet i en stor mängd olika tjänster,

 Peer-review av andras kod och diskussioner kring kod, säkerhet, infra, arkitektur och annat för att sprida kunskap till team och andra

title: Back End Developer
description:
**Senior Backend Developer – Stockholm, Hybrid** 




  





 Are you passionate about building innovative backend solutions for the energy sector in a consultancy environment? Want to play a key role in developing cutting-edge applications for a diverse client base, where you'll tackle complex data optimisation challenges and create impactful products with a focus on robust backend systems?
 



  





**What's in it for you?** 




 You'll join a dynamic team of software engineers and data scientists, specialising in custom product development for the energy industry. Your role will primarily focus on backend development, allowing you to dive deep into complex systems and data infrastructure.
 



  





 Enjoy a flexible hybrid work model, balancing time between client offices, your company's headquarters in Stockholm, and remote work. This varied approach allows you to immerse yourself in client environments, collaborate closely with your team, and maintain productivity from home when needed. You'll engage in projects of various scales, collaborating with cross-functional teams and interfacing directly with clients to deliver tailored solutions.
 



  





 You'll get a competitive salary offering up to 70,000 SEK per month (depending on your experience). They are committed to professional growth, with plans to offer clear paths to leadership roles as the company expands. With ambitious growth plans, there's potential for advancement to senior technical positions in the future.
 



  





 On top of this you’ll get 30 days vacation, a health and wellness allowance (friskvård) and private pension contribution.
 



  





**What you'd be doing?** 




 You'll typically work in agile teams of 5-6 people, sometimes scaling up for larger projects. You might spearhead new initiatives, assessing client needs and building your team from within the company.
 



  





 Your work will involve developing sophisticated data infrastructure, implementing machine learning components, and creating robust APIs. You'll use a modern tech stack including cloud services, containerisation, and message brokers. Key technologies you'll work with include Python, Django, FastAPI, Kubernetes, Airflow, PostgreSQL, TimescaleDB, Kafka, and RabbitMQ.
 



  





 You'll be responsible for designing and implementing scalable backend systems, optimising performance, and ensuring data integrity and security.
 



  





**About you?** 




 You have at least 4 years of experience in backend development, with a strong focus on Python and frameworks such as Django and FastAPI.
 



  





 You're passionate about clean, efficient code and stay current with emerging technologies. Adaptability is key, as you'll work across various domains and tech stacks.
 



  





 You’d have experience with DevOps practices (like Kubernetes, Docker, Git), cloud platforms (like AWS/Azure), and familiarity with data processing and machine learning tools. Leadership experience and strong communication skills would also be good here, as you'll be able to mentor team members and interface with clients whilst contributing to the evolution of backend development practices within the team.
 



  





 Consultant-style experience is beneficial, as client interaction is a significant part of the role and fluency in both Swedish and English is a must for effective client communication.
 



  





**A bit about them?** 




 A growing tech consultancy in Stockholm, specialising in software solutions for the energy sector. They partner with both established industry leaders and innovative startups, focusing on data-driven applications that promote sustainability.
 



  





 The company culture emphasises collaboration, continuous learning, and making a positive impact in the green tech space. They're seeking motivated individuals who can drive technical discussions and align with their mission to create meaningful solutions in the energy sector.
 



 With a current team of about 45 and plans for significant growth, this role offers an exciting opportunity to be at the forefront of energy tech innovation in a rapidly expanding organization.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Since 2014, Acast has been creating the world’s most valuable podcast marketplace, building
   

  

 the technology which connects podcast creators, advertisers and listeners.
   

  

 Its marketplace spans more than 125,000 podcasts, 2,700 advertisers and c.1 billion quarterly listens.
   

  

 Crucially, those listens are monetized wherever they happen - across any podcasting app or
   

  

 other listening platform.
   

  

 The company operates worldwide and is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden. Acast is listed on the Nasdaq First North Premier Growth Market ( ACAST.ST ).
   

  

**Location:**
 Please note, this role can be based in the UK, France or Sweden on an in-country, remote basis.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are looking for a Software Engineer that has experience with backend development, ideally in the JavaScript ecosystem.
   

  

 You will be a crucial part of an autonomous team, taking full ownership of features and driving them from inception to delivery while continuously increasing efficiency, stability and scalability of the systems.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 You will be working in a multi-disciplinary environment with agile principles.
   

  

 You’ll work across the full stack, from frontend to backend, ensuring seamless integration and performance.
   

  

 You’ll Implement and maintain CI/CD pipelines to automate testing and deployment processes.
   

  

 You’ll contribute to code reviews, providing and receiving constructive feedback to ensure code quality and best practices.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You’re an engineer with a proven track record of building and deploying applications on AWS
   

  

 You thrive in a startup environment
   

  

 You speak fluent English
   

  

**Where you'll be**
 Most of our teams are hybrids with some members co-located in offices and some working remote. With a remote first way of working we want you to feel productive regardless of work location!
   

  

 Where? For this role, it can be within the UK, France or Sweden
   

  

 Working hours? We want to avoid teams distributed over time-zones, so this team will operate within the CET time zone for collaboration. This setup allows us for more flexibility and work-life balance.
   

  

 Acast is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, national origin or any of the other wonderful characteristics that make us different.
   

  

 Culture is our number one priority as a business. We believe people come first, and we work every day to enable autonomy, continuous improvement and bring out the best in people. We’re global and have remote teams, so it’s even more important that we strive for an open, inclusive and caring environment where everyone feels visible and welcome. We consider ourselves a modern organization driven by strong values to create the best, most fulfilling and nurturing culture.
   

  

 We very much look forward to finding the next great person to join our cause!

title: Outpost24 - Senior Backend Developer (C#/.Net and Security)
description:
Does your passion for technology and development inspire your peers and encourage them to excel at their job? Do you want to be part of a senior engineering team in a fast-growing global software company? If so, you may be the right person for our senior software developer role in our Stockholm office, working for Access Risk within Outpost24. You will work with product development creating new products as well as taking responsibility for existing products used by our customers, following the entire life cycle of products.
   

  

**Position Summary**
 As a Senior Software Developer, you will be part our software development team based out of our Stockholm office. While most people on the team come to the office on weekly basis, a few of us work remotely from other places in Sweden.
   

  

 The team, while autonomous, works closely with a global team of developers, quality assurance testers, DevOps engineers, and product specialists. You will work from the Outpost 24 office, in Stockholm city, in an agile continuous delivery environment. Our team delivers cloud software (Web/APIs), on-prem components, as well as mobile apps.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As part our team, you will be expected to:
   

  

* Do hands-on development as a Senior Software Developer.
* Report to engineering manager, and work directly with Access Risk R&D.
* Be an individual contributor, working as part of an agile team.
* Be willing to learn from others, as well as share your knowledge and expertise.
* Write clean, reusable, and testable code that follows best practices.
* Design and develop products, as well as participating in architectural discussions.
* Identify and troubleshoot software defects and performance issues.
* Have your code reviewed by peers as well as take part of other code reviews.


**Education**
* Minimum of a master’s degree in computer science or related technology field


**Required Experience And Skills**
* Proven experience in C#
* 5+ years in an agile software development environment
* Knowledge of Windows and Win32
* Knowledge of security and PKI
* Knowledge of Entra ID
* Understanding of source control, automated builds and deployments
* Visual Studio, .NET
* JavaScript
* PowerShell


**What's in it for you?**
 In return for your efforts, we will offer you:
   

  

* The exciting opportunity to work in a fast-paced international environment and gain hands-on international experience
* A competitive base salary
* A comprehensive set of tools, training, and coaching on the job (e.g., LinkedIn Learning)
* A healthy work-life balance, which means you can enjoy flexible working hours
* An organizational culture founded on trust, respect, adaptability, and commitment, where your personal and professional development will be emphasized
* A flat organizational structure and lots of autonomy, you are not just a number


 And so much more!
   

  

**Application:** 
 If you are interested in joining our team and contributing to our continued success, please submit your application with your CV and cover letter via the Jobbs On career page. We look forward to hearing from you!
 *Recruitment process handled by Jobbs On SwedenTo ensure a smooth and professional recruitment process, Outpost 24 has chosen to collaborate with Jobbs On Sweden. Jobbs On Sweden will manage all stages of the selection process and will be your first point of contact for any questions regarding this position.*

title: Applikationsutvecklare inom C#.NET!
description:
Vi söker en driven konsult för att stärka vår kunds team av applikationsutvecklare. Du kommer att vara en viktig av utvecklingsteamet som skapar och underhåller applikationer i C#, med deployment i Azure-miljö. Rollen innebär att du arbetar enligt DevOps-principer, vilket betyder att du följer dina ändringar hela vägen från utveckling till produktionssättning.
 



  

**Företag :**
 X5 Group AB
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Omgående
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 X5 Music Group, ett dotterbolag till Warner Music Group, är ett musikföretag baserat i Stockholm, Sverige, specialiserat på marknaden för musikstreaming. Som .NET Utvecklare kommer du att arbeta med varierande arbetsuppgifter och successivt ta dig an mer ansvar inom programmering.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* Möjligheten att få ingå i ett härligt team med kompetenta medarbetare som har arbetat i rollen i flertalet år
  
* En arbetsgivare som ligger i framkant och ständigt arbetar med den senaste tekniken
