title: R&D - Senior Software and Systems Engineer
description:
At NOVO Energy we enable Volvo Cars to go fully electric by 2030. We are now looking for a Senior Software and Systems Engineer. We offer you a role with great freedom to solve the tasks required to support the organization, you will be a key player in shaping the software landscape at NOVO Energy.
  
  

You will, together with a small team, develop a state-of-the-art Battery Research Platform to enable the R&D researchers and engineers to push the boundaries of automotive battery cell design. We are NOVO Energy, a start-up, with the benefit of funding and expertise from our two strong mother companies, Northvolt & Volvo Cars. Embrace an awe-inspiring challenge and be at the forefront of technological advancement.
  
  

You will report to the R&D Cell Platforms Director (managing Cell Design Department) and work cross-functionally, collaborating closely with the battery cell developers and other parts of the R&D organization, as well as Volvo and Northvolt.
  
  

What You’ll Do
  
Our primary mission in the Software Team is modeling, collecting, and making available the data from our research lab to the organization through our Platform. This ranges from handling manual data entry from CRUD applications to machine integrations ingesting millions of data points per day.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Communication and Collaboration. You will work together with researchers, designers, and engineers to understand and turn their requirements into tasks in the software domain.
* Architect and own robust, secure back-end data pipelines and storage. Create responsive front-end software for R&D teams to use, from manual data entry forms to database queries to dynamic graphs and charts.
* Adapt to fast-changing internal requirements and deliver responsive changes of the platform and supporting software.
* We are a small team. You need to be comfortable with fixing things when they break and take ownership of your solutions end-to-end.


Your Background
  
  

To thrive in the role you need to have an entrepreneurial spirit and a “can do” attitude in combination with the below technical skillset:
  
  

* Proficiency in SQL Databases
* Relational databases (E.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, MSSQL, etc)
* Columnar/Time-series databases (E.g., Clickhouse, StarRocks, Timescale, Hydra, etc)
* Experience with Software Infrastructure
* Workload orchestration (E.g, Kubernetes, Nomad/Consul, Docker-Swarm, etc)
* Cloud Infrastructure (E.g., AWS, GCP, Azure, etc)
* Data pipeline Systems (E.g., Kafka, AWS Kinesis, RabbitMQ, EMQX, etc )
* Experience in Software Engineering
* Back-End development (E.g., Rust, Go)
* Basic Front-End development (E.g., Type/Javascript, Underscore, jQuery, etc)
* Bonus points
* Knowledge in Data Science/Engineering practices and tooling (E.g., dbt, Python with Jupyter Notebooks, etc)
* Experience with Industrial Iot and Industrial protocols (OPC-UA, MQTT, Modbus, Profinet, etc)


Our Offer
  
  

We offer you an R&D environment, with a clear goal to ship products. Our facility is in the central parts of Gothenburg, a small but international city with a lot to offer and nature around the corner. We will support you in a potential relocation and our comp package covers benefits to encourage a good work-life balance while being part of an exhilarating global venture!
  
  

Volvo Cars is one of the most well-known and respected car brands in the world. Northvolt is a leading supplier of sustainable, high-quality battery cells and systems, dedicated to delivering the world’s greenest lithium-ion battery. Together, we have formed a joint venture, NOVO Energy, to power the next generation of pure electric Volvo cars.
  
  

Our Gigafactory in Gothenburg will be one of the largest cell production facilities in Europe, with a potential annual cell production capacity of up to 50 gigawatt hours (GWh) - thereby enabling a supply of batteries for approximately half a million Volvo cars per year. Our state-of-the-art R&D facility will gather leading expertise from all over the world, to create the next generation battery cells.
  
  

You can read more about this joint venture in these press releases, here and here.

title: Technical Product Owner
description:
**Exciting Opportunity at Tekkli:**  

Join our team at Tekkli, where innovation meets expertise! We are on the hunt for a Senior Technical Product Owner to join our dynamic team in Ängelholm. At Tekkli, we blend a creative mindset with cutting-edge technical solutions to craft world-class experiences. Dive into an environment that values change, learning, and innovative problem-solving.
  
  

**Your Role:**  

Engage with key stakeholders across departments such as operations, finance, commercial, and customer service to gather and understand their requirements for the new SaaS solution.
  
Evaluate the current legacy application, identifying opportunities for enhancement or automation.
  
Document business requirements clearly and translate them into precise specifications for the SaaS implementation team, including the development of user journeys through flows.
  
Collaborate closely with the SaaS vendor to ensure the new system aligns with all specified requirements and adheres to the designed flows.
  
Create and maintain detailed test plans to detect and resolve any integration or functionality issues throughout the implementation.
  
Develop user guides, training materials, and process documentation to ensure a smooth transition to the new SaaS platform.
  
Responsible of the Roadmap for products.
  
  

**Who We Are Looking For:**  

A tech enthusiast who embraces change and is passionate about learning new technologies.
  
Someone with a knack for innovation, keen on implementing modern architectures and solutions.
  
A team player who values simplicity, efficiency, and collaboration, contributing positively to our shared objectives.
  
A professional with a proven track record of leading projects/products and employing best practices in product development.
  
  

**How to Apply:**  

If you are driven, passionate about technology, and ready to contribute to our success, we would love to hear from you. Please send your CV, along with your availability and a brief introduction, to join our inspiring company. We are looking forward to your application and potentially welcoming you to our team!
  
  

**About Tekkli:**  

Tekkli is a digital transformation company driven by data, tech and human insight. Our services in strategy, digital development, data, AI and cloud & Integration allow us to work with and develop our customers into the most successful companies on the market. We believe in the long-term relationship and work accordingly, helping companies and society to renew themselves and continue their development towards the future. Within Tekkli, there is an obvious challenge that infuses the company as a whole: if there is a more intelligent solution, we will discover it.

title: Junior Tech Engineer
description:
About us
  
Exxentric is a leading innovator in strength training, known for our high-quality flywheel training equipment. Founded in 2011, we revolutionize resistance training with scientifically-backed, user-friendly products like the kBox and kPulley, used globally by major league sports teams, training facilities, rehabilitation centers and home users. At Exxentric, we believe that strength matters, and our mission is to provide effective and accessible training solutions for everyone.
  
About the role
  
As a Junior Tech Engineer, you will support the tech department by assisting with data collection, integration, and analysis. You will assist in the development of our app, helping with planning and scheduling sprints, and contribute to backend coding under the guidance of our experienced developers. Additionally, you’ll have the opportunity to assist in hardware development projects, such as helping with sensor integration.
  
This position is anchored in our tech department but involves collaboration across multiple departments, offering opportunities for professional growth and the chance to work on diverse projects simultaneously.
  
Key Responsibilities (not limited to)
  
Assist in the development and maintenance of cloud infrastructure.
  
Support coding tasks and sprint planning for applications.
  
Assist in developing and implementing force plates and sensors.
  
Support the unification and standardization of data to ensure easy access for stakeholders.
  
Create profiles for future marketing and sales efforts.
  
Data flow monitoring and optimisation of CRM system.
  
Support the automation and monitoring of monthly reports for various departments.
  
  

Mandatory Qualifications
  
Excellent in verbal and written communication in English (company language) and Mandarin (developers language).
  
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Engineering with specialization in Sports Technology.
  
This position requires regular in-office presence at our office in Bromma, Stockholm. While there is some flexibility for remote work, candidates must be able to commute to the office as needed.
  
  

Essential Skills & Experience
  
Demonstrated experience working across multiple departments, with strong interpersonal skills to manage diverse project requirements.
  
Proficiency in Data Integration and Analysis.
  
Strong analytical skills with the ability to troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues.
  
Solid understanding of backend coding languages and frameworks. Preferably previous experience of working with developers to implement features and optimize performance.
  
Hands-on experience in developing, maintaining, and/or optimizing cloud infrastructure, preferably with platforms like AWS.
  
Familiarity with Agile development processes, including sprint planning, task management, and collaboration with cross-functional teams.
  
Knowledge of hardware development, including the integration of sensors and force plates into existing systems (meritorious).
  
Passion for sports, fitness and specifically strength training is a plus.
  
  

What we offer
  
We offer a position in a dynamic and innovative company, providing an exciting work environment with numerous opportunities for continuous learning, growth, and career development.

title: Cloud Platform Engineer
description:
**On behalf of our client, we are currently looking for a Senior Cloud Platform Engineer to continue to revolutionize the automotive industry.**

Our client, a global mobility technology company, partners with OEMs to transform the automotive industry as it transitions to an all-electric future. While OEMs develop new vehicle platforms from the ground up, our client creates a comprehensive solution encompassing a central computer, System-on-a-Chip (SoCs), and software to continually enhance the in-car user experience. Their products, already integrated into over 5 million vehicles worldwide, are rapidly advancing smart mobility technology, shaping the future of human-vehicle interaction.

**About the role:**

To maintain and enhance cloud platform reliability, efficiency, and compliance across major providers such as AWS and Google Cloud. This role ensures our cloud infrastructure is robust, scalable, and secure, supporting our growth and operational needs.

As a Senior Cloud Platform Engineer, you will lead our cloud strategy, collaborating with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and manage high-performance, cost-efficient, and secure cloud environments. You will optimize our cloud infrastructure, ensuring it scales effortlessly to meet future demands. Your responsibilities will include implementing security best practices, developing disaster recovery plans, and maintaining Service Level Objectives (SLOs).

Your expertise in automation and CI/CD processes will streamline operations, reduce manual interventions, and accelerate service delivery. You will also provide on-call support, proactively monitoring systems and resolving incidents to ensure uninterrupted service reliability.

**Responsibilities:**

* Monitor resource consumption and optimize costs through strategic resource allocation and usage of discounts.
* Develop and maintain automation scripts and tools to streamline cloud operations.
* Support and optimize Continuous Integration and Deployment (CI/CD) pipelines for operational efficiency and faster service delivery.
* Provide on-call support, including proactive monitoring and incident resolution, to maintain service reliability.

**Qualifications:**

* 5+ years of experience in cloud engineering or a similar role.
* Extensive experience with AWS and Google Cloud platforms.
* Strong understanding of cloud security and compliance best practices.
* Proven experience with automation tools and scripting languages.
* Proficiency in managing CI/CD pipelines.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills in both English and Mandarin

**Why join us:**

Based in our vibrant Gothenburg office, this full-time role provides the chance to significantly influence the future of automotive technology. Our leadership extends beyond technical skills to fostering an environment where every team member can thrive. We support both professional and personal development, encouraging our team to explore new ideas and maintain a healthy work-life balance. As a member of our team, you'll spearhead not only technological innovation but also the creation of a culture that values diversity, learning, and collaboration. Join us in advancing automotive technology while cultivating a supportive and thriving team environment.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
Sambla Group is a fintech company with a clear goal – to make loans better for all. We need you, your ambition and your skills on our journey. We have become the fast-growing fintech company that we are today - bridging the gap between borrowers and lenders - thanks to all the 350+ amazing people who work here.
  
Our success is the result of the commitment to deliver the best customer journey and consumer finance products in the industry. Our vision is to democratize lending and empower customers to improve their personal finances. Through our well known brands such as Sambla, Advisa, Rahalaitos, Omalaina, Rahoitu and DigiFinans we support customers in consolidating and getting the best terms on their loans.
  
We are now looking for our next Machine Learning Engineer. In the role you will join forces with the data science team and work closely in the Data team comprising several functions such as data engineering, analytics and architecture. In this role you will be collaborating with several stakeholders at Sambla Group to understand business requirements and design modern machine learning solutions.
  
  

**Amongst other things, you will work with:**  

Handle analytics requests from different stakeholders across the
  
organization.
  
Design predictive modeling solutions aimed at optimizing business
  
processes.
  
Develop and maintain production-grade machine learning pipelines
  
Define and promote MLOps best practices.
  
Provide insights and recommendations by identifying, analyzing and interpreting trends or patterns in datasets.
  
Present/visualize findings in a format that is easy to understand for
  
end users.
  
Keep pace with and navigate the fast changing world of ML/AI, and
  
leverage new technology and frameworks when appropriate.
  
  

**Must have:**  

Minimum 1-3 years of experience working with machine learning/data
  
science.
  
A degree in engineering/economics/statistics or another similar field.
  
Working experience in Python and SQL.
  
Experience working with a major cloud platform such as AWS, GCP,
  
Microsoft Azure etc.
  
Working experience in predictive modeling and machine learning
  
solutions.
  
  

**A bit of extra credit if you also have:**  

Preferably worked with Google Cloud Platform products such as Big
  
Query and Vertex AI.
  
Prior experience in the FinTech industry.
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Business in mind & people at heart – we deliver results together and celebrate our achievements.
  
A varied and challenging role in a multinational and highly innovative company, where we value the development of our employees
  
We are strong believers in creating a fun workplace where people enjoy coming to work.
  
A friendly culture with openness and respect for one another, with the possibility to influence and make a difference on society and people’s everyday lives.
  
  

Please note!
  
As part of our efforts to foster an unbiased recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to not include picture, gender, ethnicity, religion, disability, sexual orientation or age in your CV.

Strong communication and collaboration skills in both English and Mandarin
  
  

**Why join us:**  

Based in our vibrant Gothenburg office, this full-time role provides the chance to significantly influence the future of automotive technology. Our leadership extends beyond technical skills to fostering an environment where every team member can thrive. We support both professional and personal development, encouraging our team to explore new ideas and maintain a healthy work-life balance. As a member of our team, you'll spearhead not only technological innovation but also the creation of a culture that values diversity, learning, and collaboration. Join us in advancing automotive technology while cultivating a supportive and thriving team environment.

title: Storage Infra & HW Architect
description:
**About this opportunity:**
---------------------------



We are searching for one competent person to fill a Storage Architect role in our operations team.


Ericsson Lab Operations provide world class lab infrastructure, storage, networks and HW services to research and development organizations through our standardized solution and services. We enable our stakeholders to configure and deploy their design and test environment.


The Global Storage Service is supporting storage capacity with world-wide deliveries from Linköping, Stockholm and regional labs.


You will be part of our operations team and report to a Line Manager in Lab Operations Network & Storage unit.

**Main responsibility is to:**
------------------------------



Supervise, control and management of the storage service Infra and hardware platform, including future hybrid cloud environments.

* Lead the work and support in building and maintaining storage clusters, network devices and service infra environment
* Storage vendor management
* Keep infrastructure up to date and secure according to service and Ericsson design, guidelines, best practices, and recommendation from vendor(s).
* Define, drive and build technical solutions for the service
* Drive and participate in internal pre-studies/projects.
* Create and maintain system configuration and operation guidelines documentation
* Support operations team in Operational processes: Asset-/Change-/Incident-/Problem-/Request handling.


You contribute to an open and high-spirited team environment, and regularly reflects on current ways of working to propose improvements.


We offer an environment where you will be part of a team bringing the solutions, we develop from systemization to product introduction and release, taking an end-to-end product responsibility.


You will be part of strong operations and development team all the way from requirement setting, systemization, implementation, verification to customer release and maintenance.

**What you will do:**
---------------------


* Deliver Service development and projects - design, development, roadmap and improvement.
* Drive and contribute technical innovations to the service strategy plans and roadmaps.
* Maintain service anatomy.
* Lead the work and participate in HW and SW installation of new, remove, repair, upgrade, and patching.
* Act as the contact person towards Lab ops LSO for rack and installation planning including rack position usage, racklayouts and cabling.
* Act as the contact person towards C&A services for adminserver infrastructure.
* Act as the contact person towards sourcing and system vendors.
* Service business plan and budget with focus on LCM and capacity management.
* Data migration and stakeholder coordination
* Reply to general queries from users of the service.
* 2nd & 3rd line support when needed
* Ensure Storage, network and Security operations follows high security standard and Ericsson Information Security Requirements (ISR).
* Manage Proactive monitoring of services and functions using tools. Managing alerting systems and tool's (internal and auto support functions)
* Manage visualization of service usage and trends (Size (Terabytes), performance (IOPS/Throughput) etc.) in Ericsson systems.
* Management of AD set-up (EGAD/LDAP), IDM roles and user set-up, NW security zones, Certificates, system and building access, JIRA, confluence etc.).
* Documentation. (Project documentation, way of working documentation, system documentation etc)
* Adopt cloud native and hybrid cloud technology principles.
* Work collaboratively with customers to improve the product.

**You will bring****:**
-----------------------

* A spirit of positiveness and creativeness with a can-do-attitude.
* Great communication and documentation skills
* Team-spirit mentality to reach common goals together with your team with a positive mindset.
* A great deal of care for well-crafted products and services.
* MSc or BSc level in Computer Science, Software Engineering, IT, or equivalent level of knowledge.
* 5+ years’ experience as Storage engineer and Storage Architect or equivalent level of knowledge.
* Deep knowledge in storage management software and tools like NetApp, DELL, Pure, HP and others commonly used in the industry.
* Deep understanding of various storage technologies. This includes knowledge of different storage types like SAN (Storage Area Network), NAS (Network Attached Storage), DAS (Direct Attached Storage), and cloud storage solutions (Understanding of cloud storage services like AWS S3, Azure Blob Storage, or Google Cloud Storage, as many organizations are adopting hybrid or multi-cloud storage). Familiarity with storage protocols (e.g., SCSI, NFS, SMB) together with experience of programming languages such as C/C++, PowerShell, Ansible, Phyton and APIs.
* Experience in any of the following areas - Virtualization, cloud, container technologies, development of microservices, SW architecture and agile methods and continuous integration is beneficial.

 **Security clearance including references and relevant background screening will be conducted for final candidates.**

 **What happens once you apply?**

  

Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.

  

We encourage you to consider applying to jobs where you might not meet all the criteria. We recognize that we all have transferrable skills, and we can support you with the skills that you need to develop.

  

Encouraging a diverse an inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, learn more.

 **Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

**Job details:** ICT Architect

**Job Stage:** Job Stage 7

**Primary Recruiter:** Versha Sharma

**Hiring Manager:** Robert Svensson

title: Microsoft 365 Specialist
description:
**Jobbeskrivning**
 Nu söker vi specialister inom Modern Workplace / Microsoft 365 till teamet!
   

  

 Vårt stora arbete är i första hand med företag och organisationer som redan är på plats och använder Microsoft 365 i deras organisation. Vi har många uppdrag där vi hjälper organisationerna att anamma verktygen i Microsoft 365-plattformen eller konfigurerar plattformen i dess olika beståndsdelar, allt från säkerhet, automation och processer.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi tror att du brinner för att jobba med Microsofts produkter och gärna har erfarenhet av Copilot and Purview.
   

  

 Du bör ha minst fyra års erfarenhet av Microsoft 365 vilket inkluderar SharePoint, Copilot, Purview, Teams, Exchange.
   

  

**Vi ser gärna att du har**
* Design och implementation av säkerhet och efterlevnad på Microsoft 365
* Gediget teknikintresse
* Har vana att arbeta i tvärfunktionella team
* Högskoleutbildning alternativt relevant kompetens insamlad via arbetslivserfarenhet
* Goda kunskaper i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska


**Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av:**
* Automation genom PowerShell script
* Kunskap om Identiteter och Conditional Access
* Migreringsprojekt
* Dokumenterad kunskap, exempelvis via Microsoft-certifieringar


**Varför välja oss?**
 Hos oss kommer du tillhöra ett härligt team där vi hjälper varandra framåt. Du kommer att få en möjlighet att jobba med den senaste tekniken, tillsammans med branschens mest spännande kunder i ett brett spektrum av projekt som bidrar till samhällsnytta. Här får du möjligheten att få lära och ständigt utvecklas tillsammans med inkluderande, kompetenta och erfarna kollegor. Vår kultur av Power of Sharing innebär att man konstant lär sig nya saker och är aldrig statisk i sin utveckling, oavsett hur långt man har kommit i karriären.
   

  

 På Sopra Steria värdesätter vi möjligheten att jobba flexibelt, vi vet att alla jobbar för att leveransen till kunden ska bli så bra som möjligt, oberoende om arbetet sker hos kund, på kontoret eller hemifrån.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Ansök enkelt genom att antingen ladda upp ditt CV eller länka direkt till ditt LinkedIn-konto via annonsen. Observera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar inkomna via mail. Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller oss som bolag är du välkommen att kontakta Talent Acquisition Partner Johanna Romanoff, johanna.romanoff@soprasteria.com eller rekryterande chef: Pu Fernqvist, pu.fernqvist@soprasteria.com
   

  

 Samtal från externa rekryteringsföretag och säljare undanbedes.
   

  

**Ytterligare information**
 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

title: Solution Manager
description:
Do you have a strong technical background, passion for problem-solving and want to join and contribute to Trapets growth journey? Then this is the role for you! Our mission is to help businesses with the technology and knowledge needed to fight financial crime. We are now looking for a
 **Solution Manager** 
 to join our Stockholm team.
   

  

**About Trapets**
 Trapets is a market leader in providing cutting-edge RegTech SaaS solutions for the financial industry to prevent financial crime and to assure regulatory compliance. Trapets’ services simplify advanced monitoring of customers’ daily operations – from initial and ongoing customer screening to detecting money laundering, terror financing and fraud. Trapets also provides services for trading surveillance including detection of insider trading and market manipulation.
   

  

**About The Role At Trapets**
 You will work directly with our customers in large projects and offer consulting services including process and workflow review/development, implementation and deployment strategies, software training and technical guidance as well as industry expertise to ensure customers are maximising the value from their investment in Trapets technologies.
   

  

**Role Responsibilities**
* Drive successful projects from start to finish, while ensuring that any gaps are uncovered and to ensure best possible solution for our customers challenges.
* Ensure that the customer is setup correctly with Trapets systems and develop innovative ways of engaging and adding value to the customers business processes through Trapets Instantwatch platform and relevant services.
* Stay up to date on industry and regulatory trends as well as continuously enhance our processes to make them more efficient and adaptable to different solution needs.
* Create documentation such as internal guidelines, customized training material etc.


**Qualifications And Experience Required**
* Technical interest and experience of integration projects with API and complex data management.
* A consultative mindset with pedagogical skills in training and guidance of customers.
* Good financial markets knowledge ideally with some AML regulation experience.
* Excellent communication and presentation ability for a variety of stakeholders, as well as fluent English and Swedish language skills.
* Attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Strong problem solving and analytical skills.


**What We Offer**
 Trapets company values
 *Engagement* 
 ,
 *Trust* 
 ,
 *Growth* 
 and
 *Together* 
 are our guiding stars to achieve our mission to help businesses with the technology and knowledge needed to fight financial crime. We offer:
   

  

  

* A hybrid workspace with a modern office in central Stockholm.
* 50% Remote work Policy.
* Frequent office breakfasts.
* A wellness allowance of 5 000 SEK per year.
* Private medical health care insurance.
* Pension plan.
* 30 days of holidays per year.
* Regular after-work events including off-site activities.
* The ability to truly impact and contribute to the growth of Trapets.
* Endless learning opportunities via supportive and talented colleagues.


**Interested?**
 If you believe you are the right candidate for this exciting career opportunity, please apply today.
   

  

 If you have questions and/or thoughts, contact Sara Bäckman by e-mail sara.backman@trapets.com
   

  

 For more information about Trapets: www.trapets.com
   

  

 Trapets is a software company that provides products and solutions for financial crime prevention, including anti-money laundering (AML), know your customer (KYC), and market surveillance. Founded in 2000 in Sweden, Trapets has grown to be one of the Nordic market leaders focusing solely on financial crime prevention through technology for decades.

description:

As Solutions Architect, you will be working closely with Automotive OEM/Tier 1 suppliers and be the technical advocate for our client’s product line. You will be working closely with both the sales and engineering teams to gather requirements and explore new product development areas in the fields of ADAS and Autonomous Vehicles.
 



  





*On-site role Stockholm.* 




  





**Requirements:** 



* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering (or equivalent)
* Proven experience working with Automotive OEMs and/or Suppliers.

 Please contact
