 @ IC Resources for more info!

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
**Full Stack Engineer – Stockholm – 55,000 – 60,000 SEK per month**








 We’ve partnered with a truly exciting SaaS business in Stockholm, as they look to grow their software engineering team by 50% this year!
 



  





 The business is an online streaming/data business and run a fully encrypted online meeting centre. Because communication is made much safer, they are used by industry professionals to send sensitive information as secure messages and videos. Your experience in developing high-quality software will be crucial as you drive the design, development, and deployment of secure and scalable products. You will play a key role in setting the technical direction, ensuring best practices, and fostering a collaborative and innovative work environment.
 



  









 They currently have an engineering team of 7 people but with their upcoming acquisition of another tech business, their team will grow to 30 developers within the coming months!
 



  





  





 You’ll be working on a hybrid model in their Stockholm office. Most of the team are in the office 2 days per week, but you can choose to go in more if that’s what suits you!
 











  





**The role** 




 Due to the upcoming growth of the business, they are currently looking for
 **two Full Stack** 
 Engineers! You will need strong proficiency in React and Java as well as a passion for delivering high-quality software that meets real-world needs. Any experience working on video platforms or cyber security would be beneficial as well as any experience leading or mentoring junior engineers or projects.
 



  





  





  





**The process** 



* Introductory call with the CEO
* Technical competency call
* In-person meeting with the members of your new team



  





  





  





**What’s on offer?** 




 On offer is up to 60,000 SEK plus benefits, and opportunities for professional growth!
 



  





  









 Would you be interested in discussing this role with me?

title: Municipal Infrastructure Specialist
description:
**NTU International A/S** 
 is leading a consortium for a new EIB project: “
 **JASPERS on-site consultancy for institutional strengthening in Ukraine”** 
 and is looking to identify individual experts to carry out the assignment.
 



 The
 **main objective** 
 of this assignment is to contribute to the deployment of EIB/JASPERS mandate in Ukraine, by providing the necessary support to the relevant counterparts through on-site consultancy. The consultancy assignment is expected to directly contribute to enabling investments for the recovery and reconstruction of Ukraine in line with objectives of the Bank's broader EU4U Initiative.
 



**Location:** 
 Ukraine and home-based. Regular travels to Luxembourg can be expected.
 



**Duration:** 
 The intended start date is expected to be December 2024 and the period of implementation of the contract will be 36 months from the start date.
 



  





**Non-Key expert:**
 Municipal Infrastructure Specialist
 



*Qualification and skills:*



* Academic background, preferably at the master’s level or equivalent, specialized in the Municipal Infrastructure sector
* Proficiency in English; knowledge of Ukrainian is advantageous.



*General professional experience:*



* Ideally, at least 15 years of general working experience.



 Ideally, at least 10 years of experience the Municipal Infrastructure sector
 *Specific professional experience*
 :
 


* Proven experience working with public administrations and/or national organizations in the EU, and EU pre-accession countries. Advantageous to have specific experience in Central and Eastern Europe, particularly in Ukraine or Moldova.
* Preferably, at least 5 years of international experience in advisory.
* Familiarity with EU/IFI procedures related to environmental and social impact assessments, economic appraisal of projects (CBA), and international procurement standards.



 If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply and upload your CV via LinkedIn or sent to recruitment@ntu.eu. Due to the large number of applicants, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
 



**Deadline:** 
 20th of September, 2024.

title: IT Business Architect
description:
Are you driven by creating innovative solutions and developing business processes? Do you want to use your technical expertise and business insight to design scalable, secure, and cost-effective IT solutions?
   

  

 We are now looking for an IT Business Architect to join our dynamic team and play a pivotal role in bridging the gap between IT and business strategies. Do you want to shape the future IT landscape and make a real difference? Welcome to apply!
   

  

 Your future duties and responsibilities
   

  

 As an IT Business Architect, your main responsibilities will be solution design and bid work, which will include:
   

  

* Customer needs analysis
* Technical architecture
* Market and competitor analysis
* Bid development, presentations and negotiations


 Examples of What Your Role Will Involve:
   

  

* Business development and change management
* Gather and analyze customer's business requirements and technical needs through meetings, workshops, and interviews
* Develop and document the overall technical architecture for proposed solutions, including system architecture, data models, and integration points
* Collaborate with technical teams and act as a mentor to other consultants
* Develop and document reusable frameworks and best practices
* Create detailed and compelling bids that include solution descriptions, technical specifications, project scope, timelines, and cost estimates
* Conduct market and competitor analyses to ensure that the bid is competitive and meets the customer's expectations
* Participate in negotiations with customers to agree on terms and final pricing


**Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role**
 We expect you to have:
   

  

* At least 3 years of experience in managing complex projects or contracts
* In-depth understanding of business processes, business models, pricing models, and financial principles
* In-depth knowledge in IT infrastructure, software development, system integration, cloud services, AI, big data
* Good understanding of information security in relation to the development of technical solutions
* Documented experience in building strategic roadmaps for one or more solution areas
* The ability to analyze customer needs and design solutions that deliver business value
* Experience in applying agile methods and building strong agile teams
* Proficiency in both Swedish and English, both spoken and written


 Personal security requirements may become relevant if future assignments require it. You will be based out of one of our offices from Stockholm up to Kiruna. Travel is included in the role.
   

  

**Do you want to know more?**
 We look forward to hearing from you! Send your questions to Sofia Lindholm, Vice President Consulting Services Manufacturing: sofia.lindholm@cgi.com. The selection for the position is ongoing.
   

  

**What can CGI offer you?**
 CGI's combination of global and local presence, with offices in 30 locations in Sweden, ensures satisfied clients but it also means that as an employee, you always have an office nearby. This, combined with flexible working hours, provides you with the opportunity of work life balance regardless of where you are in life.
   

  

 More information about our benefits:
   

  

* Stock Program and Ownership: As a shareholder, you will have the opportunity to influence. Also, in our stock program, CGI matches your contribution up to 3% of your monthly salary.
* Wellness Grant: We offer an annual wellness grant of 4,000 SEK
* Parental Leave Pay: We pay up to approximately 90% of your salary during the initial period at home
* Secure Employment: Our consultants are employed under the terms of collective agreements and are provided with insurance coverage
* Pension Solutions: We provide attractive and beneficial pension solutions
* Company Car: The company car is used as a private vehicle but is leased by CGI


**Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.**
 Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…
   

  

 You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.
   

  

 Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.
   

  

 You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.
   

  

 Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

title: Infrastructure Establishment Manager
description:
Are you ready to take on a pivotal role in the heart of space operations? Connect Ground Systems Infrastructure is looking for an
 **Infrastructure Establishment Manager** 
 to lead our efforts in delivering state-of-the-art infrastructure that exceeds our customers' expectations.
   

  

**YOUR ROLE**
 As an Infrastructure Establishment Manager, you will be responsible for the technical design, implementation, and validation of new infrastructure projects. This includes coordinating technical staff, project managers, and external providers to ensure successful project completion. Your expertise will also support bids and proposals, making you a key player in our strategic growth.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Coordinate new antenna site developments globally.
* Interface with the Solution Architect/Sales Director to ensure design and compliance.
* Manage internal and external resources for infrastructure projects.
* Deliver comprehensive documentation packages for maintenance and operation.
* Maintain strict control over project budgets and represent Ground Systems Infrastructure in procurement processes.


**Who You Are**
**What We're Looking For:**
* A Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Science, or equivalent experience.
* Over 5 years of experience in ground station architecture and technical requirements.
* Proven project management skills, with professional certification being a plus.
* Comprehensive understanding of the theoretical aspects of the “space-to-ground”
* Experience of the Ground System hardware and operations
* At least 5 years of prior line management experience.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently.


**Personal Attributes**
* Structured, ambitious, and proactive.
* Flexible and responsive, with a disciplined and process-oriented approach.
* Excellent leadership skills and accountability for complex tasks.
* Reliable, communicative, and able to negotiate technical topics effectively.


**LOCATION**
 Our global team has primary office positions in Kiruna SE, Solna SE, Horsham (PA) US, and Santiago CL.
   

  

**NEXT STEP**
 Join Connect Ground Systems Infrastructure and be a part of a team that's at the forefront of space-to-ground innovation. If you're looking for a challenging role that offers the opportunity to lead and inspire, we want to hear from you.
   

  

 Prior to commencing employment, candidates must successfully complete a background check and a security interview

title: OpenStack Engineering Manager
description:
This role is an opportunity for a technologist with a passion for Linux and Cloud technologies to build a career with Canonical and drive the success with those leveraging Ubuntu and open source products. If you have an affinity for open source development and a passion for technology, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.
   

  

**Engineering Manager**
 The BootStack team designs, builds, and operates modern distributed systems on private infrastructure for customers. From Kubernetes to OpenStack and everything in-between, you'll be working with the latest technology in a fast-paced engineering environment. As a OpenStack Engineering Manager for the BootStack team, you will be responsible for managing the engineers that oversee day-to-day Managed Service of customer environments, including customer service management, managed services operations and consistent product improvement engineering. Collaboration with customers, product engineering, and operations is critical to success.
   

  

**As an Engineering Manager you will:**
* Manage a growing engineering team to optimise the quality and velocity of both development and operations
* Identify and measure team health indicators
* Implement disciplined engineering and operations processes
* Represent the BootStack team with respect to stakeholders, customers, and external teams
* Ensure proper team focus on priorities, milestones, and deliverables
* Work to meet service level agreements with customer deployments around the globe
* Deliver quality managed services in a consistent, timely manner


**The successful Engineering Manager candidate will have:**
* Bachelors (or equivalent) education in a technology field
* Proven track record of professional experience of either software delivery using Python, Go, C, C++, Java, or similar and/or managing operations teams
* Proven experience with OpenStack
* Demonstrated strong commitment to testing methodologies and maintainable code quality
* Experience with Linux system administration, Ubuntu/Debian a plus
* Strong communication and cooperation skills
* Experience with agile software development methodologies
* Experience working in and managing distributed teams
* Technical aptitude for understanding complex distributed systems
* Experience with cloud topologies and technologies
* Travel to team and company events and customer meetings, roughly 20% or less


**What we offer you**
 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person - we've been working remotely since 2004!
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues from your team and others
* Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
   

  

 Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Threat Intelligence Lead
description:
The Threat Intelligence Lead will own Canonical's threat intelligence strategy and execution, including understanding of which cyber threat actors are targeting Canonical, and the use of intelligence on Tactics, Techniques and Procedures (TTP) to better our products and internal cybersecurity controls. You will collaborate with internal stakeholders as well as with the wider cybersecurity community, making sure that Canonical is recognised as a thought leader on open source threat intelligence.
   

  

 This role will report to the CISO.
   

  

 You will lead intelligence gathering and development activities on threat actors targeting software supply chains. You'll study attack trends across the wider open source software landscape, report findings to internal security teams, and advise the wider engineering community on the best course of action to detect and mitigate possible threats.
   

  

 As the publisher of Ubuntu, Canonical products are directly or indirectly present in almost every organisation and household in the world, making them a prime target for threat actors. This team's mission is to help Canonical, and by extension countless community members and companies around the world, secure their software infrastructure.
   

  

 What you'll do in this role
   

  

* Build and own Canonical's threat intelligence strategy
* Build and maintain OSINT research environments
* Develop OSINT tradecraft, principals, and techniques
* Identify and track targeted intrusion cyber threats, trends, and new developments by cyber threat actors through analysis of proprietary and open source datasets
* Collaborate across teams to inform on activity of interest
* Coordinate adversary/campaign tracking
* Contribute to the wider threat intelligence community, establishing Canonical as a key contributor and thought leader in the space
* Work with product and engineering teams to explain cybersecurity threats and advise on mitigation strategies
* Work with the OPSEC and IS team to help implement/update security controls prioritising cyber defence
* Identify intelligence gaps and propose new tools and research projects to fill them
* Conduct briefings for executives, internal stakeholders and external customers


 The successful Threat Intelligence Lead will be
   

  

* An experienced threat intelligence leader (or similar)
* Knowledgeable about the current open source threat landscape and computer networking/infrastructure concepts
* Highly competent with OSINT tools (e.g., Buscador, Trace Labs OSINT VM, OSINT Framework, Maltego, Shodan, social media scraping tools, etc.)
* Able to identify, organise, catalogue, and track adversary tradecraft trends — often with incomplete data
* Experienced using threat intelligence data to influence enterprise architecture or product development decisions
* An excellent communicator with the ability to clearly articulate and tailor technical content to a variety of audiences
* Able to travel twice a year, for company events up to two weeks long


 Desired Characteristics
   

  

* A professional portfolio of OSINT related scripts, tools, or frameworks
* Demonstrated involvement in the larger OSINT community (please share relevant links)
* Degree qualified, with a bachelor's degree in computer science, information security, or a related field
* Certifications in related areas (e.g. GOSI, SANS SEC487 & SEC587, IntelTechniques OSIP, etc)
* Experience in a tech company or government/military signal intelligence departments


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Junior SAP Data Consultant
description:
Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all of these services. With our thought leadership and culture of innovation, we apply industry expertise, diverse skill sets and next-generation technology to each business challenge.
   

  

 We believe in inclusion and diversity and supporting the whole person. Our core values comprise of Stewardship, Best People, Client Value Creation, One Global Network, Respect for the Individual and Integrity. Year after year, Accenture is recognized worldwide not just for business performance but for inclusion and diversity too.
   

  

 “Across the globe, one thing is universally true of the people of Accenture: We care deeply about what we do and the impact we have with our clients and with the communities in which we work and live. It is personal to all of us.” –
 **Julie Sweet, Accenture CEO.**
**About our Nordic SAP Business Group:**
 Accenture and SAP have a longstanding relationship that extends more than 40 years. As the leading Nordic SAP transformation partner, we work with SAP end-to-end from product innovation to development and delivery. Together, we are revolutionizing the future of business through major SAP transformation programs with some of the biggest companies.
   

  

 Within our Nordic SAP community, we work with the newest SAP solutions and offerings such as SAP S/4 HANA Cloud, SAP CX, Ariba, SuccessFactors, SAP BTP and SAP RISE.
   

  

 We are now looking to expand our community at scale and are looking for candidates on several positions and seniority levels.
   

  

 To read more about our SAP Practice, visit us at https://www.accenture.com/us-en/services/sap-index
   

  

**SAP Data Nordic Value Tower:**
 Within the SAP Value Tower Data, we offer you the opportunity to work with SAP Data and to grow your knowledge within the area of Information Management, connected to SAP MDG, Master Data Management and Data Migration.
   

  

 We are looking for people who have a genuine interest in Data, want to grow and challenge themselves within that area and work with the best skilled colleagues.
   

  

**Role Overview:**
 As a junior SAP Data Consultant in Accenture’s Nordic SAP Business Group, you will be an integral part of our team supporting our clients SAP transformation projects through acting as a Functional Expert in the Data Migration and/or Data Governance areas. You will work closely with clients, translating their business and functional requirements into SAP design documents and overseeing solution delivery.
   

  

**Example project roles:**
- Advise clients on their data transformation strategies, driving value creation through the positioning of SAP enabled solutions as well as leading solutions from SAP partners and Accenture

- Be part of the data migration stream of an S/4HANA transformation, working with colleagues in delivery centers to execute on their data transformation and data upload strategies

- Work with clients on their transformational journey, by implementing Master Data Governance strategy and processes, following SAP best practices and Accenture’s proven ways of working

**What’s in it for you:**
- Help Accenture deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity

- Be part of our culture and core values in a truly human work environment

- Take part in our highly engaged and diverse global network, for collaboration and delivery

- Enjoy competitive compensation and benefits

- Develop your skills and build an extraordinary career

- Grab significant development and training opportunities to develop your business acumen, consulting toolbox, technical and professional skills

- Get internal coaching, support and guidance from a mentor, to progress in your work and professional career with continuous feedback

- Gain access to comprehensive tools and frameworks supported by our global organization, including implementation methodologies, knowledge databases, industry leading add-on software, expert networks and benchmarks

- Combine business consulting skills with technology strategy know-how

- Transform businesses with the newest technologies and making them data-driven companies

- Work with some of the biggest SAP clients in large global implementation projects

- Be an integral part of innovative SAP transformation projects

- Play a key role in transforming organizations and communities around the world. Let there be change!

**Qualifications**
**Must have:**
- Deep interest in the importance of Data

- Passion about innovation and delivery of the latest technologies to your clients

- Strong resonance with Accenture’s values

- Motivation, persistence, eagerness to optimize and drive for excellence

- Strong analytical skills, result-oriented paired with highly structured working style and good sense of responsibility, flexibility and to be a team player

- Willingness and ability to quickly learn new concepts and technologies

- Eagerness to shape and work in a team-oriented environment

- Strong will to pursue a problem, identify the source and propose possible solutions in collaboration with other team members in a timely manner

- Excellent communication (verbal and written) and presentation skills to address technical and non-technical audiences in English

- Nordic (Danish, Norwegian, Swedish or Finnish) language spoken

- A Bachelor or Master’s degree

**Very nice to have:**
- Experience with Data Migration and/or Data Governance

- Previous exposure to or user of SAP

- Knowledge in a functional or business process area

- Technical development (programming) background

**Locations**
 Gothenburg, Malmö, Stockholm
   

  

 Thank you for your interest in joining Accenture. Due to the summer holiday season, our response times might be a bit longer than usual. Please note that we will review your application in the beginning of August and get back to you shortly after.

title: Storage Architect & SME
description:
About this opportunity:
   

  

 We are searching for one competent person to fill a Storage Architect and SME role in our operations team.
   

  

 Ericsson Lab Operations provide world class lab infrastructure, storage, networks and HW services to research and development organizations through our standardized solution and services. We enable our stakeholders to configure and deploy their design and test environment.
   

  

 The Global Storage Service is supporting storage capacity with world-wide deliveries from Linköping, Stockholm and regional labs.
   

  

 You will be part of our operations team and report to a Line Manager in Lab Operations Network & Storage unit.
   

  

 Main responsibility is to:
   

  

 Drive, co-ordinate and build our services/functionalities/hardware platforms from design and requirements.
   

  

* Support in design of new services and platforms.
* Act as driver and technical coordinator for demands, projects and tasks.
* Convert design to a cost-efficient solution architecture compliant to architectural principles.
* Overall control and management of the storage service hardware and Infra platform.
* Maintain and create system configuration and operation guidelines documentation relevant to service.
* Operational tasks: Asset-/Change-/Incident-/Problem-/Request handling.


 You contribute to an open and high-spirited team environment, and regularly reflects on current ways of working to propose improvements.
   

  

 We offer an environment where you will be part of a team bringing the solutions, we develop from systemization to product introduction and release, taking an end-to-end product responsibility.
   

  

 You will be part of strong operations and development team all the way from requirement setting, systemization, implementation, verification to customer release and maintenance.
   

  

 What you will do:
   

  

 Deliver Service development and projects - design, development, roadmap and improvement.
   

  

* Drive and contribute technical innovations to the service strategy plans and roadmaps.
* Maintain service anatomy.
* HW and SW installation, including future hybrid cloud environments, of new, remove, repair, upgrade, and patching. Togheter with operations team keeping systems up to date according to service and Ericsson design, guidelines, best practices, and recommendation from vendor(s).
* Data migration and stakeholder coordination.
* Act as the contact person towards sourcing and system vendors.
* Reply to general queries from users of the service.
* Quality Assurance (Alert, Audit, Log, Security).
* Manage Proactive monitoring of services and functions using tools. Managing alerting systems and tool's (internal and auto support functions).
* Management of AD set-up (EGAD/LDAP), IDM roles and user set-up, NW security zones, Certificates, system and building access, JIRA, confluence etc.).
* 2nd & 3rd line support.
* Do risk analysis, security assessment and business continuity management.
* Ensure delivery of technical solutions, quality, highlight risks and impediments to service development teams.
* Ensure Storage, network and Security operations follows high security standard and Ericsson Information Security Requirements (ISR).
* Documentation. (Project documentation, way of working documentation, system documentation etc).
* Adopt cloud native and hybrid cloud technology principles.
* Work collaboratively with customers to improve the product.


 You will bring:
   

  

* A spirit of positiveness and creativeness with a can-do-attitude.
* Great communication and documentation skills
* Team-spirit mentality to reach common goals together with your team.
* A positive mindset.
* A great deal of care for well-crafted products and services.
* MSc or BSc level in Computer Science, Software Engineering, IT or equivalent level of knowledge.
* 5+ years’ experience as Storage engineer and Storage Architect or equivalent level of knowledge.
* Proficiency in storage management software and tools like NetApp, DELL, Pure, HP and others commonly used in the industry.
* Deep understanding of various storage technologies. This includes knowledge of different storage types like SAN (Storage Area Network), NAS (Network Attached Storage), DAS (Direct Attached Storage), and cloud storage solutions (Understanding of cloud storage services like AWS S3, Azure Blob Storage, or Google Cloud Storage, as many organizations are adopting hybrid or multi-cloud storage). Familiarity with storage protocols (e.g., SCSI, NFS, SMB).
* Understanding of programming languages such as C/C++, PowerShell, Ansible and Phyton.
* Excellent speaking and writing skills in English.
* Experience in any of the following areas - Virtualization, cloud, container technologies, development of microservices, SW architecture and agile methods and continuous integration is beneficial.


**Security clearance including references and relevant background screening will be conducted for final candidates.**
**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 We encourage you to consider applying to jobs where you might not meet all the criteria. We recognize that we all have transferrable skills, and we can support you with the skills that you need to develop.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse an inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Job details:** 
 ICT Architect
   

  

**Job Stage:** 
 Job Stage 7
   

  

**Primary Recruiter:** 
 Versha Sharma
   

  

**Hiring Manager:** 
 Robert Svensson
   

  

 ]]>

title: API- & Eventutvecklare
description:
***Brinner du för att utveckla framtidssäkra API och event-drivna lösningar med platformar som tex MuleSoft, Boomi, Apigee eller cloud (Azure, AWS & GCP)? Vi kopplar samman våra nationella och internationella kunders komponenter så att de kan realisera sina digitala visioner! – vill du vara med?***




  





**Om rollen** 




 Du kommer vara fast anställd hos oss och verka i agila-utvecklingsteam hos våra internationella och nationella kunder inom tex: Telco, Retail, Finance, Public, Industry, Utilities, media, mm.
 



 Utvecklingsuppdragen är ofta hybrid. Teamet har basen i Stockholm och är ca 30 st erfarna utvecklare med basen inom Java men även fokus på våra partners tekniker som tex MuleSoft, Boomi, Apigee, cloud (Azure, AWS & GCP). Här har du stora möjligheter att fortsätta utveckla dig inom uppdragen, kollegor (nationellt och internationellt) och givetvis via utbildningar inkl certifiering.
 



  





**Som erfaren utvecklare har du en nyckelroll.** 



* Du kommer tidigt in i projekten med uppgiften att förstå vad som skall integreras och omsätta detta till den lösningsdesign som är mest värdefull för verksamheten.
* Du arbetar i tät samverkan med både expertkollegor från Capgemini och kunden, inom utvecklingsteamet, samt med produktägare och kundens övriga intressenter.
* Du har ständigt möjlighet att ta del av Capgeminis branschledande kunskap, både globalt och lokalt, från våra experter och partners.
* Vår starka position på marknaden med kunder som är Sveriges största och mest välkända både inom den publika och privata sektorn har gett oss möjligheten till omfattande och spännande åtaganden inom digital transformation. Det utmanar oss att ständigt utvecklas.
* Vi arbetar professionellt och metodiskt i en lärande miljö och både din teamchef och ditt kompetensteam stöttar dig och din utveckling som konsult. Vi träffas ofta för att utbyta erfarenheter, lära oss nya saker i en bransch som ständigt förändras – och inte minst för att ha kul tillsammans!



  





**Vi söker dig med** 



* Flera års erfarenhet inom integrationsutveckling, API design och/eller eventdrivna lösningar
* En specialisering mot MuleSoft Anypoint, , Boomi, Apigee, Kafka, Solace eller motsvarande
* Familjär att jobba i agila team och morderna utvecklingsmiljöer
* Högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande
* Du behärskar kunddialog i tal och skrift på såväl svenska som engelska



  





**Vi erbjuder** 



* Internationella karriärmöjligheter och fantastiska kompetensnätverk. Med över 2800 kollegor bara i Sverige är du omringad av ett brett och tech-intensivt community, samtidigt som alla medarbetare erbjuds Coursera och sammanlagt över 250 000 (!) kurser och certifieringar.
* En stor bredd av innovativa projekt hos välkända uppdragsgivare, världsledande partners och tryggheten i att vara anställd i en mångårig och framgångsrik organisation
* Att bli del av en öppen kultur där Diversity är en av våra viktigaste ledstjärnor. Vi engagerar oss löpande i initiativ för att gynna mångfald och kvinnor inom tech; vi driver HBTQ-nätverk och satsar på inkludering i alla våra intitiativ och personalaktiviteter – ifrån sportklubb till konstförening. Läs mer om Capgemini som arbetsgivare HÄR.
* Vi är anslutna till kollektivavtal och erbjuder självklart en konkurrensmässig månadslön, avtalspension, ett brett försäkringsskydd och många förmåner.



  





**I enkätundersökningar lyfter våra medarbetare särskilt fram:** 



* En vänlig kultur med stor egen handlingsfrihet
* Stöttande chefer och ett öppet samtalsklimat
* Goda värderingar och ett stort fokus på mångfald
* En hållbar arbetsbelastning med fin balans mellan arbete och fritid



  





**Om Capgemini** 




  





 Som en global ledare inom konsult- och tekniktjänster samt digital transformation ligger Capgemini i innovationens framkant. Vi drivs av övertygelsen att affärsvärdet av teknologi genereras av och genom människor. Capgemini är multikulturellt med nära 325 000 medarbetare i mer än 50 länder. Med 55 års erfarenhet och en gedigen branschspecifik kompetens gör vi det möjligt för våra uppdragsgivare att förverkliga sina affärsmål genom ett brett spann av tjänster; från strategiarbete till drift- och förvaltningsuppdrag. Vi adresserar hela spektrat av våra kunders behov inom molntjänster, digitalisering och plattformar. 2021 omsatte koncernen 18 miljarder euro. Get the future you want.
 



 Följ oss på Instagram för en inblick i hur det är att jobba hos oss: capgeminise.

title: Senior Azure Specialist (XCET)
description:
**S E N I O R A Z U R E S P E C I A L I S T
   

  

 \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_**
 Full-time | Permanent
   

  

**A B O U T X E N I T**
 Xenit is a growth company which specializes in Cloud and modern work. Our committed employees inspire, challenge and encourage each other, while providing extensive value for our customers.
   

  

**W H A T W E N E E D 🙏🏻**
 We are looking for a driven
 **Senior** 
**Azure Specialist** 
 to join Xenit's Cloud Enablement Team (XCET).
   

  

 We are interested in someone who has been working within Infrastructure and Cloud for quite a few years. Maybe someone who comes from a traditional on-premise world and then found their way to Azure?
   

  

 We'd like to see someone who has experience with transition and transformation projects, and feels confident in their knowledge and expertise.
   

  

**Examples Of Potential Tasks**
* Customer projects vary from: Implementing Enterprise Scale to Transition and Transformation projects
* Guide customers on their Cloud journey
* Deployment and configuration with Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
* Working with our CloudOps service for our customers, responding to tickets assigned to the team.


**C O U L D Y O U B E A M A T C H ?**
**We Believe Our Next Azure Specialist Has**
* Preferably 5+ years of experience with Azure


 (we can be flexible with this based on how much hands on work you have done)
   

  

* A technical breadth of experience within Infrastructure - Windows Server, AD, SQL, Networking and Security
* Worked with IaaS and PaaS
* Experience with Cloud Migration and Transformation Projects
* Knowledge about Cloud Adoption Framework for Azure


**It Is a Bonus If You Have**
* Automation/Scripting Experience
* Terraform
* Azure DevOps
* Certifications: AZ-104, AZ-305, Terraform Associate


**We Also Believe That You Are a Person Who**
* Acts on their own initiative, makes things happen and takes responsibility for their work
* Finds joy in learning about new technologies, and wants to keep up to date with trends in their field
* Has a methodical and structured way of working
* Understands complex issues and is able to solve them quickly; making sensible and rational judgements.
* Collaborates effectively with others and builds good relationships with both customers and colleagues
* Enjoys sharing knowledge and experiences in order to support colleagues in reaching common goals
* Fluent in spoken and written Swedish and English
* Above all else, displays kindness and compassion in everything they do 💕


**W H Y C H O O S E X E N I T ?**
**Benefits 🎁**
 Xenit boasts a large benefits package, including but not limited to, a wellness allowance, health insurance, föräldralön bonus, ergonomic workplaces, recruitment bonuses, weekly employee surveys, etc.
   

  

**Super interesting colleagues 🎉**
 With us you will find spinning instructors, parkour practitioners, gamers, art historians, rugby players, puzzle maniacs, film geeks and much more.
   

  

 With us, you are free to be who you are. Our workforce is so diverse, that one of the only things each person has in common is an incredible drive and passion for what they do.
   

  

**Activities ⛹🏻**
 Each quarter, we have
 **Xenit Inspire** 
 where employees are able to share specialist knowledge, information about cool projects, and take part in tasks centered around innovation - workshops and hackathons. We also offer annual conferences, team building and other group activities such as basketball, Gothenburg Lap, yoga and Power Walk.
   

  

 Xenit was also recently awarded
 **"Career Company of 2024"** 
 . This prestigious recognition underscores our commitment to fostering a workplace culture that values inclusivity, well-being, and growth.
   

  

*"Xenit is an outstanding employer where corporate culture and well-being are at the center. Here, the employees are part of a warm and inclusive community where their well-being and well-being are prioritized. By offering an environment where collaboration, creativity and innovation are encouraged, employees can thrive and develop while contributing to the company's success."*
 Read more about Karriar Företagen here.
   

  

*Application information may be shared, in some instances, within the co-native group.*
 If you have questions about the position or the recruitment process, you are welcome to contact our Head of Talent: Abigail Chapman 💌
   

  

 Read more here: https://xenit.se/
   

  

 Xenit's goal is not only to become Sweden's leading cloud partner, but to be Sweden's kindest cloud partner.
   

  

 Our theory is that satisfied workers produce satisfying work, and so we aim to create a working environment in which our employees can thrive; working independently, flexibly and happily.
   

  

 We are happy with hybrid remote working, encourage collaboration between offices and freedom in choosing devices/equipment and working hours.
   

  

 Why not find out more about us?
   

  

*Welcome to Xenit!*

title: Senior Security Engineer, Solna / Hybrid
description:
Do you want to be part of a dynamic and challenging environment at the number one logistics services provider in Scandinavia? If you have a passion for cyber security and are interested in solving complex problems, join us in protecting our infrastructure that serves millions across the Nordics.
   

  

 If you have a passion for security and are interested in developing our platforms and solving complex problems, come and join us as our Senior Security Engineer at PostNord in Solna.
   

  

**Join Us**
 PostNord is looking for a Senior Security Engineer who will join our Security Operations team in Solna.
   

  

 The CISO Office at PostNord Group houses is responsible for protecting the business, enabling digital transformation and earning trust. We work very closely with the enterprise architects, network and system administrators, developers, privacy officers and production engineers to name a few; on a journey to further expand our information security capabilities. Our information security program is driven by a risk-based approach, rather than a compliance-based approach followed by highly regulated industries.
   

  

**Job Duties**
 In the role of Senior Security Engineer, you will work within our Security Operations team to ensure effective operation of cyber security incident logging & monitoring, incident response and vulnerability management.
   

  

**You Will Work With, Among Other Things**
* Ensure the effective operation of cybersecurity incident response process and streamline response to common attacks.
* Coordinate cybersecurity incident response within the PostNord Group.
* Implement modern SIEM (Azure Sentinel) to unify visibility across PostNord Group.
* Reduce manual effort by using automated investigation, remediation and response playbooks.
* Ensure alert quality, design and implement proactive threat hunting processes.
* Perform / assist in threat hunting, forensic investigations, analysing alerts and assessing vulnerabilities.


**We are looking for you who have**
 Several years of experience as an IT security specialist in a medium to large enterprise company. You have been driving changes and projects and understand how it is done within a larger organisation.
   

  

 Open minded person that is curious and social and finds it natural to share knowledge with your fellow colleagues. Can visualise problems and present them both in a technical and executive way.
   

  

**Requirements And Technical Skills**
* Hands-on experience with Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) systems and Security Operations Centers (SOC).
* In-depth understanding of IT Security principles with strong capabilities in investigating and resolving security incidents.
* Ability to visualize complex problems and present solutions both technically and to executive stakeholders.
* Proficiency in various security tools and technologies, including Microsoft Defender suite and Microsoft Purview.
* Knowledge of network protocols, firewalls, intrusion detection/prevention systems, and endpoint security solutions.
* Experience with regulatory compliance and cybersecurity frameworks such as NIST, ISO 27001, and GDPR.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a methodical approach to tasks.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey technical information to non-technical audiences.
* Ability to handle confidential information with integrity and discretion.
* Familiarity with incident response procedures and disaster recovery planning.


 We believe you are a person that is thorough, analytical, and easy to get acquainted with and learn new systems. You have a structured, responsible, and inclusive way of working. You need to be able to handle stressful situations and prioritize job tasks independently. You are communicative and easy to collaborate with and are unpretentious in your ways of creating and nurturing long-term relationships.
   

  

**We Offer You**
 We offer a variety of work in an international environment with constantly new challenges and quick decisions. Here you have opportunities to develop creative solutions and work in a prestige-free group where we jointly help to reach our goals. PostNord is one of Sweden's largest workplaces and we offer safe employment conditions and benefits. In addition to the benefits mentioned above, we offer:
   

  

* Hybrid workplace with a Nordic and dynamic environment. Watch the video about our office.
* Great development opportunities
* Great insurance and occupational pension terms
* Wellness allowance & opportunity to train at Arken's gym and indoor swimming pool
* Employee benefits through PostNord Plus - PostNord´s own personnel foundation


**We make everyday life easier**
 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region. We are in a constant transformation and work consistently to develop both our offer and our employees, all to achieve our vision of being The favorite carrier of the Nordics. We are PostNord - a fantastic company to work and grow with. Read more at postnord.com
   

  

**Apply**
 We look forward to receive your application!

title: Senior Sales Executive
description:
Nu söker vi en ny stjärna till vår sälj- och marknadsavdelning!
 



  





**Vi satsar för fortsatt tillväxt** 




 Projektportalen utmanar dagligen branschen som en av de mest snabbväxande SaaS-aktörerna inom vår nisch. Till skillnad från många av våra branschkollegor gör vi det dessutom utan investeringar från externa investerare – vi står på egna ben och vi har en hållbar affär (vilket är ganska unikt för en utmanare inom Saas-Sverige idag).
 



 Det är nu läge för oss att växa personalstyrkan ytterligare för att bibehålla och förvalta vår fina tillväxt. Under kommande år kommer vi investera mycket i vårt Sälj- & Marknadsteam, då vi ser att vår marknadsposition kan stärkas ytterligare om vi har fler duktiga kollegor i teamet.  
 



  





**Ditt Team** 
  
 



 Sälj- och Marknadsteamet är idag 3 stycken seniora Portalare. Där en fokuserar på marknadsfrågor och övriga två på försäljning. Samtliga har varit på Projektportalen i 4 år eller mer och har naturligt varit en avgörande del i Projektportalens framgång de senaste åren. Du kommer till ett högpresterande team där förväntningarna på varandra inom teamet är höga. Vi kommer till jobbet för att nå resultat och skapa värde till våra kunder och inom organisationen. Din inställning till din egen leverans bör matcha detta.  
 



 Din personlighet, din kompetens, din inställning, din identitet som säljare, ditt nätverk och din förmodade branschkunskap kommer vara en viktig del i teamets resultat kommande år. I dagsläget finns affärsmöjligheter som vi inte hinner springa på, du har chansen att komma in i bolaget i ett tidigt skede och få en väldigt bra kundstock att jobba med.  
 



  
 



**Våra fördomar om dig** 




 Vi tror till att börja med att du är en skön person med gott renommé i branschen. Vi tror du har en positiv inställning till liv och jobb generellt och att du tycker att relationsbyggande försäljning är väldigt roligt! Vi hoppas dessutom att du har:  
 



  




* Någon form av branscherfarenhet och därav en insyn och förståelse för våra kunders vardag.
* Kanske har du jobbat på ett byggföretag
* Varit elektriker, montör eller liknande
* Jobbat hos en grossist eller leverantör
* Eller rent av drivit eget inom byggbranschen.



  





 Dina tidigare erfarenheter i kombination med din personliga inställning kommer väga tungt i vårt slutgiltiga val. Är du dessutom en rolig prick, som gillar känslan av att vara i ett lag, så har du stora möjligheter att trivas hos oss. Har du egna tankar, drömmar och ambitioner så bollar vi givetvis dem. 
 



  





**Om Projektportalen** 




 Projektportalen är projektsystemet som förenklar vardagen för företag inom bygg- och hantverkssverige. Trots en lite tuffare konjunktur är vår tillväxt konstant och vi ser med starkt självförtroende fram emot kommande år. Vi har redan idag en erkänd marknadsposition och ett väletablerat varumärke i branschen. Vi har funnits sedan 2016 och är idag 12 skarpa individer fördelat på våra tre team. Vårt fina kontor ligger i Stockholm, ett stenkast från Odenplan.  
 



 Vi har en tydlig ambition om hur vi vill arbeta tillsammans och vilka förväntningar vi ställer på varandra - både i form av beteenden som kollega samt teamens och individens värdeskapande och resultat. Vi tar vår tid och vardagen på största allvar, samtidigt som vi värdesätter ett leende på läpparna och taktiska pauser i vårt fokus. Vi alla älskar att vara en viktig del av det lilla företaget, med allt vad det innebär.  
 



  





**Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer?** 
  
 



 Jag som skrivit annonsen heter Johan och är sedan två år VD på Projektportalen. Jag själv brinner för att bygga framgångsrika bolag och team där det finns en tydlighet i varje individs roll och varför allas leverans är en viktig beståndsdel i bolagets resa framåt.  
 



 Jag och mina kollegor värdesätter ett affärsmässigt driv där man gillar att ta egna initiativ. Slå mig gärna en signal (0702-848578) eller maila mig (johan.granqvist@projektportalen.se) så kan vi utforska tillsammans över en kaffe eller ett samtal om du är den vi söker och om Projektportalen är rätt destination för dig. Allt börjar med en första kontakt så vänta inte, vi kommer löpande hantera ansökningar och förfrågningar.   
 



 Vår ambition är att starta anställningen någon gång under Q3 i år.  
 



  
 



 Ha en fin dag, jag hoppas vi hörs! 
 



 /Johan med Team  
 



  





 Förmåner:
 



  




* Friskvårdsbidrag
* Tjänstebil
* Extra semestervecka​

title: Senior Enterprise Account Manager - B2B SaaS
description:
**Drive Impact with Mediatool: Elevate Global Brands with Innovative Digital Solutions. Mediatool is on the hunt for a seasoned Senior Enterprise Key Account Manager to join our vibrant EMEA sales team. This role is crucial in fostering long-term, sustainable relationships with our key clients in the B2B SaaS Enterprise space, particularly within the BSB sector.**
**About The Role**
 As a Senior Enterprise Key Account Manager at Mediatool, you will be a pivotal part of our Sales Department. Your mission is to lead complex sales cycles, generate and convert leads, and collaborate with the whole revenue teams to stimulate market interest. Reporting to our Head of Sales EMEA, you will be an integral member of our high-performing sales team, driving revenue growth and expanding our market presence
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Strategic Sales Management: Oversee the full sales cycle from lead generation to deal closure, consistently meeting and exceeding targets.
* Client Relationship Building: Develop and maintain strong, long-lasting relationships with key enterprise clients, ensuring high satisfaction and retention.
* Market Analysis: Conduct thorough market research and competitor analysis to identify new business opportunities and stay ahead of industry trends.
* Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with internal teams, including marketing, product development, and customer success, to enhance the customer experience and drive product innovation.
* Sales Negotiation and Closing: Lead negotiations and close high-value sales agreements, ensuring compliance with company policies and procedures.
* Thought Leadership: Represent Mediatool at industry conferences, trade shows, and events, positioning us as a leader in the B2B SaaS space.


**Who You Are**
* Experience: Minimum of 7 years in enterprise B2B sales, preferably within SaaS or MarTech, with a focus on selling to C-suite stakeholders.
* Educational Background: University degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field; an MBA is a plus.
* Language Skills: Strong communication skills in English; additional EMEA languages are advantageous.
* Technical Proficiency: Proficient in using HubSpot, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, AI, and other relevant tools.
* Sales Methodologies: Comfortable with solution selling methodologies like Meddic, Gap, or equivalent.
* Proactive and Driven: You are proactive, independent, and results-driven, with strong planning and execution skills.


**🤝 What We Offer**
* Competitive Compensation: Attractive salary and benefits package, including performance-based incentives.
* Professional Growth: Continuous learning opportunities and clear career advancement paths within a fast-growing scale-up company.
* Flexible Work Environment: Enjoy flexible working hours and the option to work remotely from our beautifully located Stockholm office.
* Innovative Culture: Join a purpose-driven organization with a strong company culture focused on collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning.
* Fast-Paced Environment: Be part of a rapidly expanding scale-up, where your contributions will directly impact our growth trajectory and success.


**About Mediatool**
 Mediatool is a rapidly growing SaaS company trusted by global brands like Kellogg's, Estée Lauder, and H&M. We provide comprehensive marketing management software that helps leading brands and agencies visualize results, optimize campaigns, and make data-driven business decisions.
   

  

 🚀
 **Ready to Accelerate Your Career?** 
 Apply now using your LinkedIn profile or CV and tell us why you're the perfect fit for our team. We're reviewing applications on a rolling basis, so don't wait – let's connect soon!

title: Sr. Industry Solution Architect, Automotive & Manufacturing Technical Strategy Team
description:
**Description**
 Do you have a passion for cloud computing and a proven record of driving change in the automotive industry? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team as a Senior Industry Solutions Architect at Amazon Web Services (AWS).
   

  

 As a Senior Industry Solutions Architect in our Automotive & Manufacturing Industry Business Unit, you'll play a key role in accelerating the digital transformation of the automotive sector. You'll work closely with automakers, Tier 1 suppliers, and software partners to design and implement innovative edge-to-cloud solutions that unlock the power of the cloud and accelerate the development of software-defined and connected vehicles.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* Provide deep business and technical expertise to help customers and partners architect, design, and implement cutting-edge solutions
* Collaborate cross-functionally with sales, professional services, and product teams to develop demos, white papers, and reference architectures
* Create and deliver engaging technical presentations and webinars to share your knowledge with the industry
* Work closely with the AWS developer community to shape future cloud services and features
* Become a trusted advisor to C-suite executives, guiding them towards strategic cloud-based initiatives


**To Excel In This Position, You'll Need**
* Extensive experience leading successful end-to-end automotive initiatives with Tier 1 suppliers and OEMs
* Expertise in in-vehicle software, edge computing, and cloud-based solutions
* Strong technical skills, including the ability to clearly explain complex architectures
* Excellent business acumen and the ability to turn strategies into actionable plans
* A passion for driving innovation and creating exceptional customer experiences


 If you're ready to make a lasting impact on the future of the automotive industry, we'd love to hear from you. Apply today and join the AWS team!
   

  

 Open to traveling up to 50% domestic and international.
   

  

 A day in the life
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 Provide deep business and technical expertise to help customers and partners architect, design, and implement cutting-edge solutions
   

  

 Collaborate cross-functionally with sales, professional services, and product teams to develop demos, white papers, and reference architectures
   

  

 Create and deliver engaging technical presentations and webinars to share your knowledge with the industry
   

  

 Work closely with the AWS developer community to shape future cloud services and features
   

  

 Become a trusted advisor to C-suite executives, guiding them towards strategic cloud-based initiatives
   

  

**About The Team**
 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
   

  

 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship and Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
 Knowledge of software development tools and methodologies
   

  

 Experience communicating across technical and non-technical audiences, including executive level stakeholders or clients
   

  

 Experience in design, implementation, or consulting in applications and infrastructures
   

  

 Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Automotive, or related field of study and 8+ years of related work experience
   

  

**Preferred Qualifications**
 Knowledge of cloud architecture
   

  

 Technical experience within the Automotive industry
   

  

 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch) - G54

title: Full-stack Software Engineer
description:
**Our Company**
 Keystone is one of the leading organizations to help students find the right education to pursue their dreams. While for education providers, Keystone offers end-to-end solution across the entire student recruitment value chain.
   

  

 Backed by leading Nordic venture firms Viking Venture and Verdane, Keystone has an international staff of more than 800 employees spread across 15 countries around the globe, including the UK, Spain, Sweden, and Germany.
   

  

**About The Job**
 As a Software Developer in our growing team, you will become part of an environment where collaboration, team spirit and personal responsibility is highly valued. The position offers challenging tasks and good development opportunities. You will be an integral part in making our platform even more proficient.
   

  

**What Technologies are we working with?**
* Latest versions of .NET, C# and ASP.NET MVC
* React, jQuery, TypeScript
* Entity Framework and Microsoft SQL Server
* Elasticsearch and Redis
* Cloud-computing through Amazon AWS
* Agile software development
* Continuous integration and delivery


**Who are we looking for?**
* At least 3 years professional work experience with .NET Framework and/or .NET Core.
* Good knowledge about Rest API, Entity Framework, and different test frameworks.
* Enjoys working in close collaboration with stakeholders in a fast paced and agile environment.
* Willingness to share knowledge with the team and bravely dive into new functional and technical territories.
* A great passion for building and delivering top notch products to our customers.
* Meriting but not required, knowledge of Cloud computing on AWS and its serverless offerings, ReactJS, issue management using Jira.


**What can we offer you?**
* Ability to work with cutting-edge technologies in exciting projects.
* Opportunity to work with a large-scale cloud-hosted solution.
* Freedom to help, plan and lead system architecture decisions in a fast-growing company.
* An international work environment with colleagues from all over the world.
* Plenty of opportunities to grow within the organization.
* Possibility to learn and educate through seminars, knowledge sharing sessions, relevant Tech conferences and our exciting Hackathon events.
* Monday breakfast, regular team lunches, Friday beer, team activities and fun events.
* Work-from-home flexibility.


**About The Team**
 The tech team works as an in-house tech department, based in Stockholm. The responsibilities of the team encompass developing technical platforms and solutions to lay the ground for the rest of the business at Keystone Education Group. We are a rapidly growing company that is now looking for new talents to strengthen our team. Read more about us here: https://www.keg.com/
   

  

 Do you want to join our family? Please send us your application by hitting the button "Apply here!". We are looking for someone who can start as soon as possible in our Stockholm office.
   

  

*Keystone is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are deeply committed to fostering an inclusive environment for all employees.*

title: Storage Specialist Solutions Architect, Europe North , AGS-EMEA North
description:
**Description**
 Are you passionate about helping customers build storage and cloud solutions? Come join us !
   

  

 At Amazon, we've been investing deeply in building the right solutions that allow you to derive the most value from your storage infrastructure. AWS is looking for a solutions architect for our Storage team, who will be the Subject Matter Expert (SME) helping customers to design complex solutions. As part of the team, you will work closely with Europe North customers in one or more industry verticals (Financial Services, Media and Entertainment, Manufacturing, Technology, Health Care and Life Sciences, Retail, etc.) to enable large-scale use cases and drive the adoption of advanced AWS services. You will interact with other Solution Architects in the field, providing guidance on their customer engagements, and you will develop white papers, blogs, reference implementations, and presentations to enable customers to fully leverage AWS.
   

  

 Sales, Marketing and Global Services (SMGS)
   

  

 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.

 Key job responsibilities

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship and Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**

* 10+ years of IT development or implementation/consulting in the software or Internet industries experience
