title: Testare till Hallons webbteam
description:
På Hallon fortsätter vi att satsa på vår digitala närvaro och vår enkla approach. Majoriteten av vår närvaro är på hallon.se och här sker all försäljning och service. Hallons teknikavdelning består av cirka 20 personer och har ansvaret för Hallons alla IT-system - Mina sidor, appar samt CRM och fakturering.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som testare kommer du ha lead över webben och du är med i hela utvecklingscykeln från kravställning till produktionssättning. Genom att du är med i processen från början så kan du se till att ny funktionalitet byggs på ett sätt som är lätt att testa.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta med en kombination av manuell och automatiserad testning. Ju mer vi kan automatisera, desto bättre förstås, men den manuella testningen är och kommer förbli en mycket viktig del av arbetet. Du kommer att jobba med att underhålla, förbättra och lägga till testautomatisering i samarbete med utvecklarna. Utvecklarna stöttar och tar ansvar där mer avancerade lösningar krävs. Du kommer att få dela med dig av din expertis och erfarenhet genom att arbeta tillsammans med Hallons andra testare som har lead för Hallons fakturerings- och CRM-system.
   

  

 Vi använder Cypress och Jmeter för test. I frontend har vi en modern React stack. Andra tekniker som förekommer är Node.js, styled-components & CSS, Next.js, CI/CD i Azure och Docker. Backend bygger på en modern mikrotjänstarktitektur i .NET.
   

  

 Vårt arbetssätt präglas av laganda, prestigelöshet, höga ambitioner och kundfokus. Hos oss får du möjlighet att jobba brett och ta eget ägandeskap över rollen.
   

  

**Detta kan du se fram emot**
* att tillhöra en öppen och transparent arbetsmiljö med ett arbetssätt där utveckling, delaktighet och engagemang är centrala pelare
* en snabbföränderlig miljö där ny teknik och funktionalitet ständigt levereras
* att vara en del av en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser enligt Great Place To Work samt att vi är topprankade hos Karriärföretagen av IT-Young Professionals


**Mer om dig**
 För att trivas i denna roll tror vi att du åtminstone har ett par års erfarenhet av testrollen. Du trivs med att arbeta som en del av ett team där vi hjälper varandra, delar kunskap och löser utmaningar tillsammans. Det ligger i din natur att agera proaktivt och ständigt arbeta med förbättringar. Driv, engagemang, noggrannhet och vana att ta ägandeskap är några exempel på egenskaper som kännetecknar dig. Du är en kommunikativ person som tycker om att samarbeta med andra. Då det ingår många kontaktytor ser vi att du goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Vi ser att du har erfarenhet av funktionell testning för webb och e-handel och det är meriterande om du har jobbat med automatiserad testning.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Vi tar emot ansökningar via denna annons och kommer hålla intervjuer löpande. Personligt brev behövs inte, men vi vill gärna att du svarar på de frågor vi ställt nedan i samband med att du söker. Vid frågor kontakta rekryterande chef Saul Amram.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Staff Software Engineer – Front End (Bangkok based, Relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to Know our Team:** 
 Agoda’s front-end teams focus on various product aspects including accommodations, flights, and payments. We build localized, optimized user experiences globally across mobile websites, native apps, and desktop sites, fostering innovation and constant improvement through data-driven practices.
   

  

**The Opportunity** 
 : As a Staff Software Engineer (Front End) at Agoda, you will be a crucial player in our product development team, responsible for building, designing, and optimizing user interfaces. This role involves engaging users with visually appealing and highly functional web applications. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless application functionality and deliver high-quality products.
   

  

**In this role, you’ll get to:**
* Drive collaboration with cross-functional teams such as Product, Product Design, and Engineering to construct and deliver high-quality products on the web.
* Led by example by demonstrating how to write quality code that meets the requirements and is in accordance with our architectural and front-end coding standards and patterns.
* Contribute to building a culture that optimizes applications using best practices for performance.
* Propose upgrades and updates necessary for keeping up with modern security and development best practices.
* Contribute to our shared component libraries and build modular and reusable components and libraries.
* Build efficient, reusable web components and architect reliable, performant, and scalable solutions.
* Identify areas of improvement and drive web best practices.
* Provide mentorship for more junior team members and share knowledge with the broader team.


**What you’ll Need to Succeed:**
* At least 8 years of experience of extensive background in front-end development, working with client-side frameworks on large-scale applications (React is highly preferred).
* Strong core front-end skill set in JavaScript and the TypeScript ecosystem.
* Strong architecture skills and drive decision-making in the team.
* Experience working with component libraries.
* Strong product sense and a passion for client-side performance optimization.
* Demonstrated ability to drive changes and impact across various teams.
* Love collaborating via code reviews and architecture discussions and is motivated to improve their teammates’ productivity.


**It’s great if you have:**
* Led teams and projects to solve significant, complex problems.
* Experience working on an app or internet company that is at scale.
* Experience working in a data-driven company, as well as experience analyzing and working with big data.
* Experience with modern JavaScript/TypeScript libraries and tooling (e.g., VueJS, AngularJS).
* Proficiency in modern coding and design practices. For example, Clean Code, SOLID principals, and TDD.


**This position is based in Bangkok, Thailand (Relocation Provided)**

 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. title: Thesis Project - Dynamic mock server generator using AI
description:
**Are you a final-year master's student in search of your thesis project?**
 At Bontouch, we're developing and creating digital experiences for iconic brands. Join us for a transformative research experience at the forefront of mobile and digital product development. Dive into real-world projects and make your mark in digital product innovation.
   

  

**BACKGROUND**
 In modern software development, testing and prototyping are crucial steps that require accurate simulation of backend services. Mock servers are often used to mimic the behavior of real APIs, enabling developers to test and integrate their applications without relying on actual server responses. However, creating and maintaining mock servers can be a tedious and time-consuming process, especially when dealing with complex APIs that frequently change.
   

  

 Current methods for creating mock servers are often static, requiring developers to manually define responses and update them as API specifications change. This process is prone to human error, lacks scalability, and is inefficient in handling complex or rapidly evolving APIs. The need for a dynamic, intelligent solution is evident, especially in large-scale projects where APIs are frequently updated or customized for different environments.
   

  

**TASK**
 Design and implement an AI-driven mock server generator that can:
   

  

* Automatically create and update mock server configurations based on API specifications and recorded API calls.
* Generate an integration test suite from the recorded data and qualitatively describe potential changes in the API.


**Who We Think You Are**
* Have the opportunity to work from our studio in Stockholm
* Interested in mobile development and digital products
* You plan to start your Master's Thesis project in January 2025


****HIRING PROCESS****
 🕵️ Psychometric assessment - Skills and Logical Reasoning test
   

  

 👥 1st meeting with the Talent Acquisition Specialist
   

  

 🎬 Technical challenge and case study presentation
   

  

 🎯 Final meeting
   

  

**BONTOUCH IS BECOMING FRAMNA**
 At Bontouch, we’ve always been dedicated to creating impactful digital experiences for brands like Swish, SJ, and SEB. Now, we’re entering a new chapter as Framna, with over 550+ colleagues across nine global studios.
   

  

 While our brand will evolve, our commitment to core values and crafting digital products with meaningful impact remains unchanged. We’re excited to push boundaries, explore new possibilities, and deliver solutions that make a difference.
   

  

 Start your journey with us today!
   

  

 We serve clients in North America, Europe and Asia from five studios in Sweden, London and New York. The products we help create are used by more than 50 million people in 195 countries. Read about our products at bontouch.com

title: Rust Engineering Lead - Linux and Open Source
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1000+ colleagues in 70+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring
 **Rust Engineering Leads** 
 of all levels of experience to drive the adoption of this exciting language into the full range of Canonical offerings, starting with Ubuntu but also our own projects and open source offerings. We see Rust as an important new language for system level services and capabilities, and a natural evolution path for the sort of software that would traditionally have been written in C or C++. We believe that there is an opportunity to rethink the foundations of future Linux systems with Rust as a central driver of change in everything from the system firmware and embedded software, bootloaders, up through the kernel and input handling, all the way to the desktop.
   

  

 We also want to ensure that Ubuntu is the very best platform for Rust development, offering easy access to the widest range of tooling and capabilities that support cutting edge open source and enterprise development.
   

  

 This job posting is our general process for Rust engineers of all levels of seniority, for all relevant teams at Canonical. Apply here if you are an exceptional software engineer who prefers to work in Rust. After the first round of interviews we'll find the best fit product team at Canonical for you to progress your application based on your personal interests.
   

  

 Canonical has substantial projects in Python, Go, C, C++ and we are starting to invest in Rust. For front-end development we prefer React and Flutter.
   

  

 Join us in our mission to deliver innovative open-source solutions to individuals and enterprises around the world. We expect the highest engineering standards and strong motivation to get things done well in a fully home-based and distributed environment. These roles require extensive personal experience with Linux - the more different versions of Linux the better!
   

  

**Location** 
 : we have open roles for Rust engineers in every time zone.
   

  

 What your day will look like
   

  

* Design and implement well-tested and well-documented software in Rust
* Advocate for Rust adoption in Canonical and upstream projects
* Identify projects and codebases that could be prioritised for Rust adoption
* Debug and fix issues encountered by your users
* Participate in our engineering process through code and architectural reviews
* Collaborate with community and colleagues on technical specifications
* Seek improvements to engineering and operations practices
* In some cases, deploy and operate services developed by the team
* Contribute to the success of your product through technical advocacy


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* An exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
* Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or STEM, or a compelling narrative about your alternative path
* For more senior roles, experience building, deploying, and operating distributed systems and APIs
* Drive and a track record of going above-and-beyond expectations
* Well-organised, self-starting and able to deliver to schedule
* Appreciative of diversity, polite and effective in a multi-cultural, multi-national organisation
* Professional manner interacting with colleagues, partners, and community
* Experience designing and writing high-quality Rust software on Linux
* Experience with and passion for Linux at the system level
* Professional written and spoken English
* The work ethic and confidence to shine alongside motivated colleagues
* Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
* Passion, thoughtfulness, and self-motivation
* Result-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments
* Ability to travel twice a year, for company events up to two weeks each


 Nice-to-have skills we would value
   

  

* Experience developing for Ubuntu
* Experience with LXD, MicroK8s, SnapD, IoT, Juju, Ubuntu Core, Ubuntu Pro
* Performance engineering and security experience


 What we offer colleagues
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Salesforce Architect
description:
At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible,
 **meet some of our customers** 
 or
 **take a look at some of our products** 
 .
   

  

**Salesforce Architect**
 We are seeking a seasoned Salesforce Architect to lead our platform's evolution as we embark on a significant digital transformation journey. This role is pivotal in designing, developing, and implementing innovative Salesforce solutions that drive business growth and enhance customer experiences. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in architecting complex Salesforce environments, particularly within Sales and Service Clouds, and a deep understanding of platform capabilities to support a growing user base of over 450 users.
   

  

**Your responsibilities will include:**
* Develop and execute the overall Salesforce architecture strategy, aligning with business objectives and digital transformation initiatives.
* Lead the design, development, and implementation of complex Salesforce solutions across Sales and Service Clouds.
* Optimize Salesforce performance, scalability, and security to support a growing user base.
* Ensure data integrity and governance across the Salesforce platform.
* Lead and mentor a team of Salesforce developers and administrators, fostering a culture of continuous learning and innovation.
* Stay up-to-date with Salesforce product releases and industry trends to drive continuous improvement.
* Act as a point of escalation for complex Salesforce issues, providing expert-level troubleshooting and resolution.


**We are seeking a candidate with:**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. Advanced degree preferred.
* 7+ years of hands-on Salesforce experience, including Sales Cloud and Service Cloud.
* Proven experience as a Salesforce Architect with a strong portfolio of successful implementations.
* Extensive experience with Salesforce integrations, data migration, and custom development.
* Expert knowledge of Salesforce platform, including Apex, Visualforce, Lightning Components, and SOQL.
* Proficient in Salesforce integration patterns, including REST/SOAP APIs, middleware solutions, and third-party integrations.
* Strong understanding of Salesforce data security, governance, and compliance best practices.
* Familiarity with Agile methodologies
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Strong leadership abilities with a proven track record of mentoring and leading technical teams.
* Strategic thinker with a proactive approach to problem-solving and innovation.


 By joining our team, you will have the opportunity to make a significant impact on our business and shape the future of our Salesforce platform.
   

  

**Next step:**
 Please address your questions to Mikaela Nilsson (mikaela.nilsson@tobiidynavox.com) and submit your resume (only in English) or LinkedIn profile through our website. We're looking forward to your application!
   

  

**Where we stand:**
 We believe diversity not only enriches our workplace culture, but also gives us a strategic advantage. Working with people from a variety of backgrounds and perspectives helps us all become better communicators, better problem solvers, and better human beings. Our differences make us stronger.
   

  

 Tobii Dynavox values equality of opportunity, human dignity, and racial/ethnic and cultural diversity. Tobii Dynavox does not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, age, veteran status, ancestry, or national or ethnic origin.

title: Storage Infra & HW Architect
description:
About this opportunity:
   

  

 We are searching for one competent person to fill a Storage Architect role in our operations team.
   

  

 Ericsson Lab Operations provide world class lab infrastructure, storage, networks and HW services to research and development organizations through our standardized solution and services. We enable our stakeholders to configure and deploy their design and test environment.
   

  

 The Global Storage Service is supporting storage capacity with world-wide deliveries from Linköping, Stockholm and regional labs.
   

  

 You will be part of our operations team and report to a Line Manager in Lab Operations Network & Storage unit.
   

  

 Main responsibility is to:
   

  

 Supervise, control and management of the storage service Infra and hardware platform, including future hybrid cloud environments.
   

  

* Lead the work and support in building and maintaining storage clusters, network devices and service infra environment
* Storage vendor management
* Keep infrastructure up to date and secure according to service and Ericsson design, guidelines, best practices, and recommendation from vendor(s).
* Define, drive and build technical solutions for the service
* Drive and participate in internal pre-studies/projects.
* Create and maintain system configuration and operation guidelines documentation
* Support operations team in Operational processes: Asset-/Change-/Incident-/Problem-/Request handling.


 You contribute to an open and high-spirited team environment, and regularly reflects on current ways of working to propose improvements.
   

  

 We offer an environment where you will be part of a team bringing the solutions, we develop from systemization to product introduction and release, taking an end-to-end product responsibility.
   

  

 You will be part of strong operations and development team all the way from requirement setting, systemization, implementation, verification to customer release and maintenance.
   

  

 What you will do:
   

  

* Deliver Service development and projects - design, development, roadmap and improvement.
* Drive and contribute technical innovations to the service strategy plans and roadmaps.
* Maintain service anatomy.
* Lead the work and participate in HW and SW installation of new, remove, repair, upgrade, and patching.
* Act as the contact person towards Lab ops LSO for rack and installation planning including rack position usage, racklayouts and cabling.
* Act as the contact person towards C&A services for adminserver infrastructure.
* Act as the contact person towards sourcing and system vendors.
* Service business plan and budget with focus on LCM and capacity management.
* Data migration and stakeholder coordination
* Reply to general queries from users of the service.
* 2nd & 3rd line support when needed
* Ensure Storage, network and Security operations follows high security standard and Ericsson Information Security Requirements (ISR).
* Manage Proactive monitoring of services and functions using tools. Managing alerting systems and tool's (internal and auto support functions)
* Manage visualization of service usage and trends (Size (Terabytes), performance (IOPS/Throughput) etc.) in Ericsson systems.
* Management of AD set-up (EGAD/LDAP), IDM roles and user set-up, NW security zones, Certificates, system and building access, JIRA, confluence etc.).
* Documentation. (Project documentation, way of working documentation, system documentation etc)
* Adopt cloud native and hybrid cloud technology principles.
* Work collaboratively with customers to improve the product.


**You will bring** 
**:**
* A spirit of positiveness and creativeness with a can-do-attitude.
* Great communication and documentation skills
* Team-spirit mentality to reach common goals together with your team with a positive mindset.
* A great deal of care for well-crafted products and services.
* MSc or BSc level in Computer Science, Software Engineering, IT, or equivalent level of knowledge.
* 5+ years’ experience as Storage engineer and Storage Architect or equivalent level of knowledge.
* Deep knowledge in storage management software and tools like NetApp, DELL, Pure, HP and others commonly used in the industry.
* Deep understanding of various storage technologies. This includes knowledge of different storage types like SAN (Storage Area Network), NAS (Network Attached Storage), DAS (Direct Attached Storage), and cloud storage solutions (Understanding of cloud storage services like AWS S3, Azure Blob Storage, or Google Cloud Storage, as many organizations are adopting hybrid or multi-cloud storage). Familiarity with storage protocols (e.g., SCSI, NFS, SMB) together with experience of programming languages such as C/C++, PowerShell, Ansible, Phyton and APIs.
* Experience in any of the following areas - Virtualization, cloud, container technologies, development of microservices, SW architecture and agile methods and continuous integration is beneficial.


**Security clearance including references and relevant background screening will be conducted for final candidates.**
**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 We encourage you to consider applying to jobs where you might not meet all the criteria. We recognize that we all have transferrable skills, and we can support you with the skills that you need to develop.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse an inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Job details:** 
 ICT Architect
   

  

**Job Stage:** 
 Job Stage 7
   

  

**Primary Recruiter:** 
 Versha Sharma
   

  

**Hiring Manager:** 
 Robert Svensson

title: Thesis Project - Evaluating Kotlin on iOS using KMP
description:
**Are you a final-year master's student in search of your thesis project?**
 At Bontouch, we're developing and creating digital experiences for iconic brands. Join us for a transformative research experience at the forefront of mobile and digital product development. Dive into real-world projects and make your mark in digital product innovation.
   

  

**BACKGROUND**
 Cross-platform programming for mobile has been around for a while, e.g., React Native & Flutter. In recent years, Kotlin Multiplatform (KMP) has gained traction as an alternative for mobile cross-platform programming but is still not widely adopted.
   

  

 This thesis will focus on evaluating Kotlin Multiplatform (KMP) as a viable alternative for iOS development, specifically focusing on its performance, usability, and integration capabilities compared to native Swift development.
   

  

**TASK**
 Depending on your interests or previous experience, the thesis could focus on different aspects. You could, for example:
   

  

* Evaluate the runtime performance, memory usage, and app launch time of iOS applications developed using Kotlin Multiplatform compared to those developed natively in Swift.
* Analyze the trade-offs between code reusability and platform-specific optimizations. Investigate how much platform-specific code is required to achieve optimal performance. Assess the impact of Kotlin Multiplatform on development speed and maintainability.


**Who We Think You Are**
* Eager to work from our studio in Stockholm
* Passionate about mobile development and digital products
